Q4QzxgjJvT4kq_Y6UPbjUQ.text: If you like the elderly and are not a minority its the place to go!   If your too loud they kick you out or come over and tell you to be quite.   Not the place for people looking to have fun.

O-edGqXqXExh6qlhVyyGUw.text: Stopped by after playing kickball at papago park. I wasnt expecting much as I have always considered it solely a bar. Where the particular item I ordered was strange for my taste buds it was good. I had the Jamaican chicken salad with the jerk chicken. I must admit the chicken was cooked perfectly and the flavor was delicious. I also had a bite of my friends' chilli, also tasty. Finally, it also amazed me to know they accept children before 9pm. I know, I know who brings their kid to a bar? In my defense, I learned this eve that they earn the title bar AND Grill for a reason, that reason? A six page menu with plenty to choose from. I am fairly certain we will return before seasons end. Oh, my waitress was awesome and cooperated in bringing my bill right away so I could be sure we got out before 9 :)

JN_WpMW8Xgwk-o-FdJASYg.text: Don't ask me why, but came in to Dukes again and paid $2.95 for an Iced Tea.  Then proceeded to pay $2.00 for each refill.  $6.95 for Iced Tea?   I guess we will be drinking water going forward.

gn09YSJuvFnczmOlOA8B2A.text: Dukes is hands down my favorite dive bar in Scottsdale. I have had some major life events take place at Dukes, including a boyfriend dropping the "L bomb" for the first time. How romantic, right?!   Anyway, I always have a good time at Dukes. They have about a million TVs, pool tables, shuffleboard, darts, Buck Hunter etc... Definitely a little something for everyone! I find their drinks very reasonably priced - it seems like they always have specials on beers and shots.   The food is pretty decent for bar food. I'm a big fan of the buffalo style wings, they're nice and big and juicy. Nom nom nom!   Dukes also provides a free cab service if you happen to indulge in too many spirits. Don't drink and drive, y'all!  My only complaint is that once or twice I've caught some attitude from a bartender, but that's probably a fluke and service is usually fine for a dive bar.

O_S5ChCKye3sSEUytliukg.text: The bartenders are the only reason I listed this as a two star, I've had several issues with Dukes and honestly I've given too many second chances. Monica is the best bartender in the valley and is totally worth it a visit. The food not so much and the waitresses are garbage, they cuss customers out and ask for Id's just for water and the manager laughs in people's faces.

o0VrlvZKvj84PM9BdqJ11w.text: Decided to try this place for Super Bowl. Seating was OK and some TVs didn't have best clarity. People were there to watch the Super Bowl, yet they didn't have all the TVs tuned in for it. We asked, since the ones over the bar had every other TV on another station and it was distracting. Waitress said they are a sports bar so they needed to play any other sports on TV. Watching a story about Allen Iverson or Curling was not worth even having on, but they wouldn't change the stations.  Ordered Chili Cheese Fries that come with cheese and onions. Our server asked if we wanted cheese and onions?!?  So what are chili cheese fries without the cheese? They came, cold and without onions.  I ordered ice tea and found out that refills cost money. Who does that?? Asked for dessert menu and was told they don't serve any desserts because their kitchen is too small. The owner, I presume, had the nerve to ask if we wanted dessert because we don't drink?  People who drink, eat desserts. Not a place I will go back too. Wasn't impressed, at all.

GyUvbWXGk3XTil0w14RnYQ.text: There are no words to describe how rude and absurd of a man the owner is. After seeing that Duke's had the channel our favorite football team was playing on, we decided to stop in for some appetizers and sports. For the first portion of our visit, everything was okay. We ordered chips and wings, all of which were average but sufficient. On top of this we had a friendly enough server.   As many do, upon eating we stuck around to watch more of the game. That's when everything turned sour... or more specifically we had the delight of meeting the owner. Now, the owner was someone we noticed from the beginning of our meal, as he sat at the bar eating nachos and cheering against the U of A as they played their game (not for their opponent, just enthusiastically against them). Upon realizing we were Wildcat fans we soon became recipients of many dirty looks, but remained unfazed thinking he was just another restaurant patron. As the half progressed the looks became more frequent, and we realized that despite being quiet and respectful customers, he clearly had an issue with us. During halftime he made it known, as he rushed to our table, angrily grabbed our napkins off the table, and then proceeded to condescendingly yell at us, demanding we order more food or get out. We understood his point (although it could have been delivered more kindly), and began picking out new items to order. We then ordered, only to be angrily reapproached by the owner five minutes later yelling at us and asking whether we had chosen something to order. We explained that we had, at which point he then said, "WAIT!!! Are you guys 21?!" We replied that one of the three of us were, promoting him to yell at the top of his lungs, "STOP. STOP. YOU CANNOT BE HERE WITHOUT ADULTS!" We had seen many children and had seen no signs explaining this policy, and were left extremely confused, and with an entire restaurant of people turned in their seats to watch him yell at us, with their jaws dropped. He then said our order was cancelled and we had to leave.   In all honesty this review doesn't do the situation justice at all. The owner was an EXTREMELY rude and aggressive drunk man, who singled us out over a sports rivalry (there were MANY other tables of people watching sports without food on their tables, and we had done literally nothing to draw his attention or disapproval). He treated us extremely immaturely and condescendingly, and showed no evidence of skills in customer service. In fact, one of his staff even came up to us and apologized for the owner being a "drunk a$$hole." We left sad and embarrased, not to mention angry. Worst experience ever.

h6mpBJiVdXitMehpsvMAlg.text: The beer was not cheap, and the food was horrible. I'm pretty sure it was frozen food they heated up in the microwave and sold to me for like 12 bucks. What a scam!  The only reason I don't give it 1 star is this would be a fun place to go to hang out and watch a game or play pool, but don't expect it too be cheap. I think you could get cheaper prices on Mill or Old Town.

7gMTXoXGQ1QPHqKUBtVhKQ.text: Good ol' Duke's! This place is a standard for us. We go there often and LOVE trivia with Darel! Service is hit or miss. Some times we have great service, other times it is dismal. Prices are decent and it is a fun atmosphere. It is a good local spot with staff you will recognize. BTW, this is where I had my first date with my man, so that gives it four stars!

15FXkjtzWUcxaHsZtoAalQ.text: Ok. I had two five dollar gift cards and decided to try some food and a beer. I still refused to order any of their thirty salads, but I did try the $8.45 grilled buffalo chicken wrap and it was better than expected, but still three star material. The buffalo sauce had a good kick and the chicken was grilled strips - it was all stuffed into a tortilla with grilled onions and a few peppers and lettuce. They forgot my side of dressing and the fries were standard frozen, but crisp and the slaw was good, but not homemade. They serve late, so if your in need, try the wrap, you will be filled up. Couple bucks less and it might have been a value deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Buffalo chicken wrap

iFZN8_jfUl_79Iv65BKQSg.text: This place is awesome. Our hotel shuttle driver recommended it to us as a midpoint from our hotel to the Scottsdale Stadium (shuttle can only drive a 5 mile radius and the stadium was outside the radius, but save us money for a taxi he could drop us off here, and there is a free shuttle that takes you from Duke's to the stadium).  Pros: (+) $4 mimosas. What a deal! (+) Awesome atmosphere (cool laid back sports bar) (+) A plethora of TVs so you can watch whatever game, wherever in the bar (+) Bartender was friendly  (+) Games as well - shuffleboard and billiards from what I saw, there may be more but I don't know (+) Looked like a sufficient food menu (+) Tons of seating  Cons: None! Seemed like an awesome place. We were only there for about twenty minutes and it was the middle of the day, but I would definitely go back!

uhx6XzHpfJHhVYEKL45-MQ.text: Great place to watch games and drink. Lots of tvs and I'd say the food is on the better side for a sports bar.  They have phone chargers and the service is usually timely.  If in the area I would check it out.

SxzNkYbwudDYzXVtUzH_Zw.text: Sports bar?  If it's not in the AZ area, they don't have a clue.   They would rather play UFC replays that regional college basketball.   No consideration when asked to change channels.  "TVs are set as they are. " was the answer we received.   Slow service, mediocre food and hostile bartenders round out this experience.

cGMk4Atrp8TYzo1PnboLzQ.text: Great little neighborhood bar (my cousin loves this place). It's huge with great vibes - everyone is friendly. Their beer selection is a bit lacking (I'd like to see a few options other than the normal Bud, BudLight, and a few "crafts"). Food is pretty good.

NaWrsgX7oDDRlpEFpT0Ghw.text: Totally sufficient for a few rounds of pool or darts while keeping an eye on the 67 tv screens they have mounted on the walls.  Just stick to the cheap pitchers of domestic beer. I ordered a rum and coke and it tasted like cleaning products.   I would come back, but only if I didn't feel like driving all the way to Lucky Break in Tempe.

VXBdWpBkx_wHxvKVNiicKg.text: If you want to eat in a barn with a bunch of animals then sit on the Dukes patio. And the waitress pet the Animals and then serve you food. So it's now called Pigsville instead of Dukes! Or if you want to sit outside away from the pigs, you can move to back of patio and inhale all the second hand smoke and die from that. Overall it is a disgusting place. I wouldn't even Piss on the patio let alone eat there and if you want your animal fix just order the food because the waitresses will bring your food after they have petted all the gross animals.

WKgfwnuGwv1o99_NSexErg.text: This is a great restaurant/bar!  I usually go with my boyfriend but sometimes we bring our kids AND our DOG!  When there is no kids with us, we sit inside and watch sports with TV's everywhere!  If kids are with us, we can enjoy playing some of the games that are separated from the bar (darts, pool, shuffle board, etc.).  And we especially love going with our dog on the patio.  They bring water bowls and treats out for them and there is usually other people with their pets as well.  The food is really good!  I love the Ruben and their Jamaican Salad but honestly, I haven't had anything I didn't like.  Plenty of beers on tap.  Prices are good. Restaurant is always busy and laid out nicely.  And finally, if you've had too much to drink, they have a free cab service right outside the bar.  You can't beat that!

2iq7XWfXVS1WsoZL1AjM6w.text: First time here in years and I must say that the quality of food has gone down hill dramatically.  Came looking for a specific game, from Gilbert, AZ mind you and they did not have my game on with sound. I understand we live in AZ and with the Cardinals but you have to accommodate all customers which they did not. They said and I quote "This is what you got.". The quality of food has gone down as well. Spinach and artichoke dip had very little spinach and a whole lot, over abundance of artichoke.  Pick it up Dukes.  Very dissatisfied customer.

wqa8s34YtErO0545we1Ycw.text: The food is awful.  Cold and tasteless.  Service so so.  Had to tell waitress twice for items.  Beer was good

Cqr-crJrnJhDqfLxGvwPcg.text: We went to Dukes last night and had a great time! We ordered cheese sticks, which were delicious but a little cold in the middle, hot wings which were fantastic, meaty and classic . The ribs  pulled right off the bone and came with creamy coleslaw. The drinks were so cheap. 4.25 for a vodka cranberry and 8.50 for martinis. The bonus was team trivia. The questions were not too easy nor too hard and everyone seemed to be having fun with it. We came in 5th but in our defense, there were only 2 of us playing and all other teams had like 5 -8 people. The only complaint is that the game, the jukebox and the trivia emcee were all playing so it was hard to hear the questions. They should turn off the other stuff when trivia os on. Our bartenders were great and although they wear name tags, I forgot their names...Crow and Monique, maybe? Ran into some old friends and a good time was had by all.

f0rRCpnJQt7ShHy_pAKBXA.text: I love dukes!! Never had any bad service here, price point is good and I find the atmosphere nice!!!

laTV9o3WBDgMXttpSxjm_A.text: I have to let the public know the Salmon at Dukes is amazing, you will thoroughly be satisfied !!!! Never dry, over cooked, &  litely seasoned to perfection, the digestion and flavor is certainly hard to distinguish from the wild salmon where I lived in Northern British Columbia, Canada!!!!!  Seafood Salmon LOVERS  THIS IS A FOOD THAT YOU WILL CRAVE !!! Ummm try it I've never been disappointed !  Thank you Dukes I had a relatively quiet .....relaxing dinnerawesome conversation with Scottsdale City Employee,  a disc golf tournament player, &  great staff !!! ..I  look forward to  nites as this !  Thanks to Co-owners  "Allen & Jackie McCarthy". (father/daughter owned coming up on Two 2 Decades

a4K_G__80ViPa0kymno4fA.text: Took over a hour to get our food,  order was wrong so had to wait again... Didn't take it off the menu with either wanted to charge us for a refill too. Didn't check on us much, no apologies and we had to ask for the check. Soda was still almost $3. I got water, I know how nickel and dime this place can be. Used to love them, now... Nevermind. Server was chill but lacked emotion and enthusiasm, tired maybe, but dealing with that wrong order was wack...

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Back tvs

gWNTn8l4mUPyRsZi5M2TSg.text: Good drinks, good food, and overall a good time! Also there is an entire room dedicated to foosball and pool which pretty cool!

XktMV7zzNQd2wrdDhWbYAA.text: Just there for game 7 of World Series, an historic event either way, yet they have no volume or low volume for the game.  They have some trivia guy yelling at full volume but are unable to get game volume.  They also had rodeo and other bs on tvs not realizing the importance of this game.  I gave up a long time ago but gave a second chance tonight.    Won't be back for anything important.   I could imagine what they would do for a Super Bowl. ...  Loud Kareooke? ????  Not a Sports Bar.  See elsewhere.

8o3ZHqgwRJ6xnYoZTaJneg.text: I'm somewhat of a regular.   Duke's is a local sports bar in south Scottsdale. It's right on the green belt, so it's convenient for cyclists, disc golfers, and dog walkers who use the park. The property kind of has two sections to its patio with both overlooking the park.   There is a lot of space inside with tons of TVs. There are pool tables, shuffle board, arcade games, etc. They have bar trivia twice a week, and the regular emcee is friendly.   I usually just drink beer here as far as alcoholic drinks go. They usually have at least four IPAs on tap which I wish they'd rotate in some other ales. If you order a pitcher, they'll give you an ice chiller.   I think the food is good. It's not fried dive bar food. They have some unique dishes. I usually order the sliders, steak salad, fried shrimp, or chicken tenders.   The service is great. Lots of personable bartenders and waitresses who are attentive and friendly. They'll put on any game you request, too, without hassle. The owner is regular, and he'll say hi to customers.   It's a great spot for catching a game, pit stop for park guests, bar trivia night, or if you live in the area, for pregaming or capping off a night in Old Town or on Mill.

Db16r6juEMIQp4ADXlLNEQ.text: This bar is located on the greenbelt. So when you're riding you're bike and feel a little thirsty, just ride up and have a drink. The fish and chips were yummy. I tried not eat all of it but I couldn't resist. The fish was thinly breaded, which was awesome. But I felt like it was overcooked. I may need to try it again. The steak was okay. The bartenders were super nice but I forgot their names. Sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish and chips and tater tots. Yum

9iDpxOstTHuNqfFJ6M7uWQ.text: I come here about every 3 weeks. Always enjoy The Dip or the Rueben.  Service is consistently very good and attentive. Krissy is outstanding!

url3VMD8fcq9HI74xR8h3Q.text: First time here.  Didn't know what to expect.  Pretty nice place and good selection of draft beers including local beers.  Only negative was that they don't put Buzztime trivia on a tv, have to use the tablets.  Never had that happen before.  Everyone who has Buzztime puts it on tv's. That's how you get group synergy and get your bar in the national rankings. Helps us drink more, too.

aKaVUI_4OPJSWg5WsrmyrA.text: I usually come to Duke's on Wednesday nights for Trivia. It's probably the best sports bar in Scottsdale. Here are TVs all over the place and they actually have the volume on!  The food is always decent. Some things are better than others but I haven't had a bad experience yet.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lots of TVs!

Z9rm6QcSj5bYO-mB4mdhiw.text: Woah Nelly! The exterior give no indication how spectacularly large the interior is.  That's probably a good thing given how packed this place is on Sundays during football season. I came here as part of a UYE Jeff E. planned (thanks el Jefe!). I was stunned when I opened the door.   More like floored by the amount of people. Luckily they sent a hunting party to find me.  You need to get here early (before they open) to claim a table during NFL season. No joke!   The televisions are fairly large. So no matter where you're seated you're guaranteed a sweet view.  For food I ordered sliders as I wasn't up for a big plate of food. A set of (3) were only $6. They were delish!

When my friend and I ordered a shot, the bartender didn't know how to make it.. that guy said the ingredients,but forgot an ingredient.  When I said it needs a splash of sprite also, he thought I didn't hear him and he said ya it needs sprite if you're gay. bsSvTDVkC-1aPMHwp71ciQ.text: So sad to write this but it needs to be fixed ASAP! Please have a manager !!!  Past few times horrible service . We won't see our server for a very long time and won't get drinks unless we start another tab at the bar .  Honestly -anyone - just stick with sitting at the bar . It's very hard to track out anyone for a meal,drink or bill.  ( and it's not that busy )  Sad .not sure if we will be back for awhile .

B32OokgrKSchfaUMnFSU2g.text: We had a great time playing trivia. The man running the trivia show was really sweet. I wish they had the trivia question on the TV screen. That was the only thing that I would say. It was a lot of fun going to a bar and having entertainment for two or three hours. Much more interesting and fun then  just sitting there drinking

oU0X2N-W7rcktoVs7_d1UQ.text: Server was an ass, left before we even ordered. I know Dukes does not care, because they were busy. They won't ever miss my business, and they will never get it. F, you to the ass server.

CbMAaM3XOjpZ-rIi8v26lQ.text: I have been coming here for a few years now and love Monica.  By far my favorite 'dive bar' with both the perfect amount and variety of bar games.  The food isn't bad either!

NSPQ0N92o_Qk9HwypVxV8A.text: Wings were solid, big and cooked well.  Chili was decent with lots of cheese.  Southwest burger was cooked nicely, mayo on the bun was a mistake.  Tater Tots were crispy.  Beer menu could have used some more craft beer but I'm splitting hairs here.  Good joint, will be back.

oZF8zI98OP_VlfGkp7U0qQ.text: Pros: Dog friendly patio. Separate Non-smoking and smoking patios. Overlooks greenbelt.   Cons: No Happy Hour food specials?!!! All apps are $9-$11 (wings are $11!!!).   Maybe that's why it's dead inside and out on a gorgeous day during HH.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7vdL9VebnA1zVETAhiDQcA.text: This place definitely was a great stop while getting my car looked at. Thanks Eddie for the recommendation!  When I first walked in Dukes this place was busy for lunch. I walked into the bar and took a seat. I was immediately greeted by a nice lady. She handed me a menu and I was a little overwhelmed with how big it was. I quickly scanned it and saw they had a breaded pork tenderloin! Coming from the Midwest this is a staple I had very frequently coming from Iowa. I placed my order and realized they had a ton of TVs! My food arrived very quickly and I destroyed the pork tenderloin and tator tots! This place was a quick in and out for lunch while the staff was very friendly! They checked on me over 10 times start to finish. Thanks for the great service and excellent food!

wvjhwTZ8ksYYGs_tYpNgKg.text: I'm a big fan of this place. Great service, good prices.  It's a nice sports bar atmosphere.

I4hyK2O1hV47a2PxCamEDw.text: I don't know why I kept going back to this place. First of all if you go there you will probably get bad service. They have two people that work their that are good, the rest of the staff is horrible. They are remodeling the place, they need much more than a remodel.  The owner needs to take responsibility of his establishment and not let his staff run his restaurant. Remodeling isn't going to improve sales it's the staff.  Have I mentioned how bad the staff is there. Could be a great place but no one cares there. Don't bother going to this place. I would love to see it go under and have some new take it over that actually cares. Go to pranksters, much better service.

pD4fNr8Op0gEecp-_eSNyw.text: Yah! Found another great place for lunch near the office. Had the Tuna Steak Caesar Salad and it was fantastic - huge chunk of tuna and only $8.50  This place is always packed at lunch. $2.50 burgers on Monday, $6.95 prime rib on Tuesday, $6.50 Salads - 29 of them, on Wednesday. You get the picture.  BOTTOM LINE: Good 'n cheap eats for Lunch. Probably a great place to watch sports too, but I go there for lunch

eZPUGz9KSSOfEn0V6nDq7w.text: This spot was conveniently located right by the hotel I was staying at for work. I decided to go there since it was past 10pm and most places near by were closed already. All of the bartenders were very nice and struck conversation. There's a ton of TV's. Which is great for a day of watching all your sporting events. They even had a complimentary taxi service to avoid drunk driving and DUI's. I thought that was cool. I ordered the Cajun Salmon Salad. It was extremely boring! The food I'd give 2 stars. The 3rd star is because I was happy with the Customer Service.

-ZywTr6byd-FnH6zqBo--Q.text: Finally a place to watch local sports with sound.  I always find it unbelievable that many sports bars here in town look past our local teams and support the foreign hoards from Wisconsin, Minnesota, NY, Illinois etc..  Not at Dukes...local first.  Please return to your frozen tundras and leave us with the Suns, Cardinals, Devils and Coyotes.  The food here is nice bar/pub fare and is always fresh and hot.  Drinks are plentiful and service respectable.  Would like to see a little more variety on the taps but other than that Dukes is a great place to catch a game.

gIroxzbCiNsn9qIhpGDf0Q.text: Now that the head chef went to another restaurant the kitchen is disorganized. They knew tonight would be a busy night with the asu college game but they still ran out of the daily special. I think this is piss poor management from an owner who has supposedly been in the bar business for 30 plus years. Maybe he should pay more attention to his business instead of if he has a full drink in front of him. The servers are great and friendly. The bar would be dead if it wasn't for his daughter running this place during the day. On dozens of occasions a random non-Arizona sports game has been on the main screen instead of the diamondbacks or coyotes game. This might as well be a dodgers home city bar because the dodgers are always on the big screen. When we ask the bartender if we can watch the diamondbacks they say the owner is at home watching the bar on security cam and wants the dodgers on. Does he think the dodgers will bring more business?  Lol...forget ever coming here if you are a  hockey fan. The owner hates hockey and it's never on the big screen. This bar has only survived this long due to the area lacking good restaurants. Hopefully that'll change soon with the new development happening on McDowell. The only reason I come back to this place is because it's within walking distance. He needs to remember that there's  more on than shitty Montana football.

0DaKbm6LnVmjJj9koXzc0w.text: We go here regularly - it's a good sports bar with decent grub.  Lots of pool tables and other activities you would find in a sports bar - but with a staff that sets it over the top.  I can't rave about the food but I can tell you it's consistently good, but not great.  They do have a great variety of salad options (and wraps) that is fairly unique for a sports bar setting.  The location over the park is excellent, great for locals to ride bikes or walk to.

lrsieVr22vyzFZUgRboiBQ.text: First off, I have never seen a double spread on a sports bar menu for just salads-- wow!  We got just some fried appetizers to accompany all our booze so I can't say more about the food except that it came really really fast and killed the hunger pain that had set in prior.  Paula was our server and we were a really rowdy mix of people and she handled the gang  well--  attentive, fast, friendly.  TVs all over the walls, a decent looking patio, pool tables, Golden Tee type arcade games and my favorite, shuffle board.   Sound was at a good level, almost wished it was louder b/c our conversation was pretty offensive and I didn't want others to hear it!

shlcEdPPLw0b_ZpmK0pe2g.text: There's something about sports bars in Scottsdale and Phoenix that's always makes me feel like I'm getting nickeled and dimed. I found Dukes to be the best out of that group though.  Dukes reminds me of a Doc & Eddies North. It doesn't feel corporatized like, say,  Gallagers.  Dukes is kinda divey, feels like your large local bar and it did a good job accommodating our groups for college football games.  I even saw a private area reserved for fans watching the University of North Dakota. If your bar can accommodate fans of an FCS  school, I'm impressed.   TVs are spread throughout the bar, there's a pool table and games and they are consistently open Saturday mornings so you can watch your team's 9:00 am kickoff (unlike some bars).  I haven't been to Dukes in a long while. I once watched a game there when a drunk football fan tried to fight me because I tried to explain to him two teams from the same conference cannot play in the Superbowl. He felt like I was showing up his football intelligence.   He was there alone and I was with a group. When I told him I wouldn't go into the parking lot with him he went to the bar and stared me down   waiting for me to leave. One of the ladies I was with complained to the staff. He offered her a free drink for her inconvenience. She then explained to him that it wasn't her he wanted to fight.  Okay, so the staff isn't brilliant. It's still a good place to watch football. Unfortunately I can't comment on the food because I don't remember eating any. I think Tempe and Chandler sports bars are better values when it comes to food.   I'd go back to Dukes over Upper Deck, Gallagers, Half Moon, Full moon or Blue Moon.

NTDo3CrsG17J58TMOKuH4w.text: We have been regulars there for almost 6 months now.  We bring our friends, co-workers and family to enjoy the food and atmosphere.  We often stop in to have a drink before heading to the air port, helps with getting thru security!  Our favorite foods are the Wings and the Chilli Nachos!!  The staff is top notch, they have treated us like family, we have actually made very good friends with them and have spend time with them outside of Duke's.  I couldn't have found a better place to sit with my wife and discuss the day's events and play Bingo!  Jon, Mandi, MJ, Emily and Trevor, We will becoming to see you soon!!

5Q0_2Pg-mCEyDEmzF6d7jQ.text: Go here if you: Like to watch sports Don't like to wear anything fancier than a brand new T-Shirt Just want to chill out Hate to dance Like pool Like beer  Don't go here if you: Take 2 hours to get ready to go out Drink fine wine when you go out Can't decide whether PCL or Dirty Pretty is your favorite bar Expect a DJ Don't like an age diverse crowd  This is an awesome spot to grab a beer and watch the game.  The place is generally full of people that are similar in tastes.  I am not sure if I would classify this one as a dive bar, but it does have somewhat of that feeling.  It is also a lot bigger than it looks from the street.  If you like sports bars and are nearby, it is a must to try it.

nIL3U0U4dlkP8euadctDMg.text: We stopped in at this bar on a Friday afternoon after realizing that the gluten free bakery in the same shopping center had closed it's kitchen. We were seated outside on the side patio. We enjoyed our view of groups playing Frisbee golf and people out enjoying the beautiful day. The food was pretty mediocre. We started with the fried zucchini appetizer. I ordered the veggie burger sans bun with fries for my entree and my sigo had the Philly Cheese steak sandwich with Au Jus. My "burger" came with a measly piece of lettuce so I asked for extra which I don't believe we were charged for. The food we had was just OK.

RavIuUo5Ig4plhmEnUijWQ.text: I used to live within walking distance of this place, and it has major kudos because it is on Vista Del Camino park, which has a pretty sweet disc golf course on it!  It is on hole 12 actually!  Most people make this their hole one, and finish up here!  The other cool part is you can take your dog on the patio..at least you could when I was there.   The BBQ hot Buffalo wings, which are not on the menu, but you can ask for them and they may be available, are deeeelish!  I love em.  I also love to see a place that has a two page spread of salads.  But, I do not want said salads to come out with lettuce from the green salad mix bag, YUK!  I love salads, love love love them!  But don't be fooled by the two pages of salad options, they are all served with the premix iceburg lettuce bags. YUK again!    I really love this place because it looks SUPER small from the outside, but is actually pretty big on the inside!  They have like 10-12 pool tables and they are in pretty good condition. They have 2 shuffle board, 2 electronic dart boards, and at least 4 old school dart boards with the chalk board scoring system!    I definitely recommend this place if you live in the area, the bartendar's and waitresses, or waiters, will get to know you fast,, and your experience will get better every time.  Just don't go there with hopes of having dinner.  Bar food and late night snacking types o' meals!

LTbLVeOsRyss7hHbhGThpA.text: Not a bad spot.  They have a pretty decent selection of beers on tap, for reasonable prices.  Plenty of TV's.  They have two rooms of pool tables, with more tables than the majority of bars in Phoenix.  Most importantly, they have all of the sports channels.  As a Boston fan, this is the only place that I've found that has NESN.  They are very willing to put on a dedicated TV for you if you ask...not always with sound, but it's better than nothing!  Plus, there usually aren't too many college douche-bags there, so it's generally a chill atmosphere.  Also, their back patio is awesome, as it looks out onto the greenbelt, rather than a parking lot like most places in the valley.

XgdQ-34MQ7u6Stvau3GtCA.text: Great sports bar, tons of TVs with all sorts of sports.  Food is pretty good for a bar.  I ordered a grilled salmon salad and the salmon was prepared very well, it was not over cooked as most non-seafood specific places tend to do.  Server, Meghan, was very nice & kept my drink full.  Free wi-fi is always a plus.

0kEY9hhQjJ7ACrUVwNcbVw.text: The menu is a vegetarian's nightmare. You are pretty much stuck with either nachos (does not include beans) or a veggie burger (obvious microwaved boca burger). They do have shuffle board, but you have to pay, and its timed, so make sure you pee prior to dropping in your quarters because you got maybe 15 minutes to bust that game out or your screwed.

62Pr5XAgOacKls1-ZDFmew.text: Duke's is the best neighborhood bar in this area: HANDS DOWN! The menu has been revamped and everything that I've tried is ABSOLUTELY delicious. We go there anytime we can and the service is always on par...there are fun games, lots of TVs that play all the games, and the patio is dog friendly. Great place that I'd recommend to anyone!

MGobzsJ_j3yrn_bAszH5RA.text: I only had a couple of beers here so I can't judge the food, but the atmosphere is great. It's much larger inside than it appears from the parking lot. The staff is very helpful and courteous and they had tons of TV's. It was a great place to watch sports and I would definitely go back.

qSKQAtfjeur0ZZZhptsXPQ.text: This place could be great if not for the owner!  While having a conversation with the manager about a very small issue (and we where having a pleasant conversation) this old man walked up and stood behind the manager.  I asked the manager, "who is this gentleman?"  Turned out to be the owner who proclaimed, "I OWN THE F*****G PLACE, THAT"S WHO I AM....WHAT IS YOUR PROBLEM!?!?!"  I asked the manager if I'd said something wrong and he stood quiet.  It was clear he deals with this a lot.  Maybe it's because his boss sits at the bar and drinks and then tries to interject when he clearly shouldn't.  The story goes on from here, but I digress.  My friends and I paid out tab for one pitcher of beer (so we where there less than 20 min) and took our business elsewhere.  After spending $286.00 at the other location it has become our new hangout.  There is another post here about the owner kicking out a Kings fan....I find that story COMPLETELY believable after what we had happen.  I wouldn't spend ten cents in this place all because of the owner!

jVdaJmEu-kwuDF-TW9Cr6w.text: THE WORST BAR FOR DRINKS........stay away from this place.  The food is very bad and greasy and don't complain because you will get asked to leave... the owner is a complete jerk and drunk most of the time.... if you go stick to the beer the bartender has no idea what she is doing...The places is filthy....just go when the lights are on!

xXjx4tVSSYipR6d0X30C5A.text: In walking distance and pet friendly! It sure beats the hell out of pranksters scene and service. The servers are always so friendly and give your puppies treats and water. The food is okay. But for drinking a pitcher on the patio and relaxing mixed with the small amount of exercise you get from the short walk it is definitely becoming a bar that I am a frequent customer at!

8Vo4WqZk_WcpMi0my3c1Nw.text: I'm not even a big fan of sports and this is easily my favorite bar. The prices are really cheap for a bar and the food is good considering it's just bar food. They have daily specials including a day where you can get a two dollar hamburger with fries. This means its a real hamburger, not a tiny little thing. My mom and I can share it.   Pool, Shuffleboard and Darts are available as well as other games. Electronic cards and racing. The service is always amazing even if theyre very busy. I've never had a bad waitress here.   The best part is that they have a giant private room and guess how much it is to rent it out? It's completely free. You just have to book it in advance. They could have easily charged a lot for that private room since it includes its own shuffleboard and pool table.   Also they have a FREE designated driver who will take you home. All they ask is that you tip them. There's no reason to ever go anywhere else.

0IvIb3Y6eTTH6evNwDt4ww.text: Lame.....................  So I was looking for a good dive bar near my house. I am not talking Apache Rd in Tempe divey, where the patrons could possibly stab you, but a good low key hang out. I need a Cheers.  When I read the Michael C.'s great review that said they have free car service to pick you up and drop you off I thought I had found my place!  OH how I hate being wrong!  I went here with a friend Saturday night, after waiting 30 minutes for the car to pick us up, the driver told us he had no change so we could tip him. So we ended up giving him in a tip what a cab would have cost us. It was obvious he was scamming us, but what is the point of confronting him? I needed him to take me home later.  Now this one won't be a negative for the guys, but there were way more chicks than guys. I prefer a few more guys in a bar.  But I guess the biggest missing element for me was fun people to talk to. I love going to a bar with a friend, having a few drinks, and meeting fun people to talk to. Those people weren't here. It was a weird crowd, and not in a good way. One weird solo guy at nearby table was actually leaning in and listening in on our conversation, then he would make comments out loud, but to himself, about what we said. His back was to us the whole time. The whole thing was a little One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest. The music and the karaoke were entertaining, but I prefer a bar that has interesting people who you want to meet.  The waitress was almost completely devoid of personality. The little that was there obviously hated being at Dukes! She sucked, and she screwed up our bill.  One lady who worked there named Cynthia stopped by for a minute, and she was cool and friendly. Thanks for the 5 minutes of friendliness Cynthia!  Another negative was the brightness of the bar. Hello, bars should not be that bright. You needs just the right combo of alcohol and dim lighting to meet your future ex-boyfriend.  Just an overall disappointment! Unfortunately, I won't be back there anytime soon.

V54mIkBcYk-y2VVI7TipoA.text: We went there for lunch today. The food was good but the service was horrible. I got a burger with sweet potato fries. The ketchup was fermented to fix the problem. ICK! Good luck trying to get anyone's attention! Obviously won't go back after this experience.

xXiv8LRGZgdAqo77bU-gEg.text: I have my favorite servers. Great service, love my Tuna Steak Cesaer salads! Thanks for caring: Jesse, Jenifer, Shawn, Megan, Monica, and cooks Jesse and Jason who do the best job of cooking the Tuna Steaks. To make it perfect, make the Tea stronger and the Ranch dressing thicker.

OxH8ehjwCIltpfoJortLOQ.text: Free car service to get you there and home safe??? Hell yea!  Dukes is a divey, large sports bar with a million TVs, decent food, and cheap ass drinks.  Specials every night ($2 burgers on Mondays), Karaoke on Wednesday and Saturday... Pool tables, shuffleboard, a misted patio for smokers, etc...  Located close to old town - so this is a great place to get your party started!  This is a found treasure :)

PGzytxc47qx7KL0ZA4afLA.text: The menu of salads is expansive!! And on Wednesday nights they have a special on the salads for I believe around $6.50. They also have sandwiches, drinks and an outdoor patio. I was really impressed with the salad I had.. I know salads are hard to get wrong but it was a big heaping portion of greens with yummo fried chicken atop and a bonus that I happened to go on a Wednesday night for the special. (:   I know this place is popular, they stay open until about 12A every night and serve food very late. Millions of TV's, seating and a chill atmosphere.  I haven't had a drink there but am definitely thinking about it next time before I hit up Old Town Scottsdale since I live nearby.

znsZc4BhzCqGQyQg3X-j5Q.text: Ugh....when you have thoughts that you are going to a dive bar, and you get this?  Not a pleasant thought.  Went there with a friend on Saturday night (can you all guess who that was??? LOL)  and the first thing I kept on thinking was..."Wow this place is bright."  Very sports bar atmosphere with horrible Karaoke and weird people.    Yes, there were a lot of ladies there....so the pickings for men were slim.  I had a couple of drinks and all I wanted was to find a decent guy to stick my tongue down his throat!  (Kidding, y'all)  All I got was some pretty boy who thought we were talking about curling and some weird dude next to us who sings a bad ass Barry Manilow.   Oh!  And when we were waiting for our ride (plus on the car service availability) some weird freak of nature walked up to us outside.  He was talking to me in some weird radio announcer voice in my ear.  All I wanted to do was run hom and shower and sanitize my hair and ear.    2 stars for the chicken fingers (yummy) and car service.    So not a dive bar.

yDMEWKbF80qH1Z5efUZkcQ.text: Great place to watch any sports game.  They have TV surrounding the place, it gets loud when a big games are on.  But great food and drink specials.  Try to get there early, sometimes you can't find a parking spots if you go late.

QQJrY3I_Ck1usgFLB6g_fQ.text: Love this place! Erica is the best!! She makes the best margaritas! Can't go wrong! #teamerica!!!

DEv3U7FjucB8DBbVKmkqIQ.text: I love this place! It's right down the street from our house, & we come here almost every weekend. It might not be the nicest looking place, but the food is awesome & the waitstaff is great. Their prices are also great, & I love that they have pool tables. Yes, the interior could use some updating, but I think the datedness adds to the charm.  If you're looking to uppity snooty Scottsdale, this isn't the place for you... But if you're looking for laid back people, good food, & good prices, this is the place.

AvyBnaZoyftATfPcmc165g.text: Duke's is the top place in Scottsdale that my friends and I like to hit up to watch a game, or just grab a drink and bite to eat. The place is huge, the food is priced well for a bar, and there's almost always a decent beer special.  In addition to several TVs placed around the bar, there's plenty of pool tables, dart tables, and shuffleboards to keep everyone entertained.   The menu is big for a bar. The odd, also very good, part about that menu is the salad selection. Duke's has two pages of its menu dedicated to salads. While not something you'd expect from a sports bar, it's nice to know that there still is a healthy selection I can choose from while watching a game.  Another cool feature is Duke's "No DUI Car."  It'll take you to your next destination.  How can you not like that?!

gWQF-F4YiflQSHr3VomfIA.text: Pool tables. Shuffleboards. College Football games galore. And of course, plentiful pours of the Malibu Rum :) a great spot for fun times!!! And did I mention Sundays they have free pool from 7pm to close?? Wow!!! Plus Duke is from Montana. Double the star rating!!!  Bonus points for their car service when you get a bit tipsy :)

B7qLYfkzpYlKjtr40GBKhg.text: Great place good food and fast service! I would like to say my wife got harassed by one of the gym trainers from across the street while she was waiting in her car in your parking lot, we no longer feel like we can go here safely without being approached and questioned by a bodybuilder from pt by joes when I just wanted a burger.

cFRhZwLFBqV_GkGyauGF2A.text: I am very convinced that there is no such thing as a sports bar with good service in Scottsdale.  Dukes is no exception.    I went to Dukes last Sunday for the Chargers game and it was packed.  I was pretty happy to see a sports bar within stumbling distance to my house that was actually a lot bigger than it looks from outside.  Sure, its in a strip mall but I can overlook that.    What I cant overlook is how downright miserable our server looked when she was actually anywhere near our table, which wasnt often.  I almost deducted two stars for this, since other friends of mine had been there the day before and said their service from another girl was equally as poor.    What I do like about Dukes:  Cheap drinks Bloody Mary bar A billion TVs Shuffle Board The layout and big space Free Wi-Fi (No I did not take my laptop, but for those fantasy football players that must have their scores immediately, it seemed like a good thing)  All in all, a good place to watch the game, whoever youre cheering for.  Maybe service at the bar (instead of at a table) is better.

nbodRfCligoyxu0vAImMjA.text: Typical sports bar, in dire need of some redecorating! This place looks (and smells) like 1974, nix the HD tv's. Its an OK place to meet a pal for a beer, but no dates, or it'll be your last date with that Gal!

ywlSvd48ONzsoP9XkiMZ2w.text: I give this place 4 stars, simply because the staff is so friendly and interactive.  I didnt catch the bartenders name (red head) but she was so nice and everyone looked to make sure that we were happy.  Watching football on a weekend day, it was very easy to make us happy.  The food is not exceptional, but very good price wise, and there are plenty of games to keep people interested.  I have taken a first date there on a few times, and it has only helped never hurt.  Based on fun and customer service I gotta give the 4th star.

zHT11QyJAlaxAfGqb2bucg.text: A bunch of Co workers and I went here for lunch thinking of breaking the normal lunch time routine.  Well the experience was terrible to say the least.  Our waitress lost our simple order and came back to us a half hour after she took our initial order to admit it.  Things happen, Its understandable.  But another half hour goes by with  no signs of our food or even a heads up when it might be coming out. Now we are late coming back from our lunch break and we just wanted to pay for our drinks and go. We felt as it was forced upon us to stay and did not feel like it was right.  So long story short. She did not give us any discount on her mistake,  they gave us to go boxes.  Messed up everyone's order in the to go box,  and each paid 13 dollars for a lunch that tasted so un-cooked that half of us ended up throwing it away... If you do go here..  Just make sure you have plenty of time to hang out.

4QFFh2HI6ayM_TvZ4dZyog.text: Not a fan of the food However, I do appreciate that they have a LOT of salads on the menu! Yay!  This is a good neighborhood bar.  If you're looking for trivia, karaoke, cheap happy hour drinks and you live in the neighborhood.... GO!  If you don't live in the neighborhood, don't bother.

dnoaMTt0Y6PCV9GOQo-tqA.text: This place is amazing. It's really bright inside, has tons of huge televisions, more pool tables than you can imagine, lots of places to sit, and several various bar games... just a billion things to see and do here. It's like a fucking carnival in Vegas.  The drinks and specials are quite reasonable, and they have a pretty good selection of beers on tap. They have a good bar menu and lots of salads. I had a chicken caesar and it was mighty fine... I saw some of the other food and it looked pretty rich and greasy. Don't go here expecting to get diet food. The rest of the menu is nachos, burgers, sandwiches, soups, wings and other assorted deep fried stuff. Even though they let me put my own dressing on my salad, and I didn't use much,   The crowd sucked when I was here, but I imagine it varies wildly on any given night. The staff was super nice. I mean, the friendliest bartender I've ever met. This place has so many things going for it, but so many things against as well. For starters, it's located in a hidden useless strip mall behind a Denny's and a Peter Piper Pizza. It's also trying to be too much. It's like a local dive bar with lofty aspirations and a high self-esteem.  It's totally worth going to, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend it to anyone unless they asked specifically for something exactly like this... but such a request would be unlikely. They have a long list of things going on here, so if this is close enough to your neighborhood to make it your neighborhood bar - you could do worse.

bFl0Cg7anF3yVN6dcX2Tbw.text: I went here on a Friday night for trivia and the place was packed.  They have a lot of pool tables, shuffle board and a million TVs.  Everything you could ever want in a sports bar, right?  Well here is what you don't want. It is SO loud in there you can barely have a conversation.  Our server was missing most of the night and when he did show up he screwed up our orders.    I give it three stars, 1 for the wall of TVs showing different games, 1 for the menu that has a lot of variety including 2 pages of salads, and finally 1 star for the fact that they have a bloody mary bar.  This alone will get me back in there to watch football on a Sunday morning.

4cWTklZ1bdzti-a6YnPRRg.text: Just moved into the area and just amazing welcoming staff. Tvs galore. MLB package and amazing friendly service

PkVyjb30Pw5uxPHn7gnQaw.text: Drink refills are $1.00. Since free refills are industry standard in the U.S., it makes restaurants that do charge come across as greedy, insulting, or unappreciative of the business.  Ordered 2 small fountain drinks for my kids ($3.90 total) and they wanted $1.00 each for refills. We could have stayed there all night getting free refills and Dukes still would not have lost money.  Spoke with the manager but she stood her ground on the rule. Food was average for bar food. Perks were bike parking by the patio so you could sit buy your bike if you're on a ride through the park and free WiFi. In the future we'll be stopping at Zipps instead.  Sorry to see them lose future business trying to squeeze a couple extra dollars out of me on one visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. $3.90 for two small kids drinks and they still want $1.00 per refill. This is greedy, insulting, and unappreciative to patronizing customers

Il_82uHDBs_9lXxq72sRZg.text: It was a good sports bar. Only 4 stars because they don't have Kiltlifter on tap. Otherwise it's a good place.

Tr0cuDYSaZ4vrs5A5uIBkw.text: Duke's is quite an interesting place, hidden away in a random Scottsdale shopping mall. I've been here a few times for team trivia with friends- both Wednesday's and Friday's. One of the organizers has frequented for a few years and notes that it's never busy one night over the other. You'll see a variety of patrons at Duke's, it's not a typical place for one group or another.  Service is kind of hit or miss, sadly. One evening the server was on point! He knew when to swing by & ask for refills, the food didn't take long to order and be delivered. And it appeared had a bunch of tables- my props to him. One of my more recent trips was the opposite, surprisingly since they weren't terribly busy. The guy seemed very out of it. He walked by our table a few times without acknowledging our attempts to get his attention, and also disappeared the entire time it took for our food to be delivered (25-30min). Cashing out was quite painful with him too.   The food is just kind of meh. I was told they pride themselves on salads, but I've not been impressed- over-dressed, not a lot of anything else. The totchos are decent, nothing else is really worth mentioning. I'll probably return since my friends love it and I love trivia.

8zngjHM4eiPxLJlHhRdT2Q.text: I am in town on business, so eating out more than usual. Location is close by and menu varied enough. Most servers very friendly and the owner Jacki works hard to ensure customers and staff are happy. It's sad that one server attitude prompts a person to write a response after 4 weeks of 3 or more visits each week to be motivated to put a 1 star on the site. For the second time, the server adds other persons drinks to my bill by mistake. the first time I mentioned it, I ended up just paying, it was minimal, and didn't want to make a scene. He didn't offer to take it off. The second time I stood up for myself and he got angry. He wouldn't even listen to my response...It was his mistake again.  I am writing this review because of his attitude and not the $. He wouldn't even listen and stormed off. My tip for his fellow bartenders would have been 4x the amount of the wrong amount on the bill. I tip very well according to standards. Because of his attitude, they lost their tip AND I will go elsewhere 3x/week and not go back. The ironic part is, 30 minutes prior to my situation, the person next to me asked him to take a charge off his bill he never ordered and the sameserver did with no complaint. So, I know for a fact its just not me for wrong charges. I wonder how many other people this person overcharged, or wrongly charged ??? Me 2x and my neighbor in one week. I haven't disputed another bar bill in 5 years, so I guess it hit a nerve... just sayin'

FO1RUhu0DZu5fhDoFt8-Zg.text: Not too bad of a place but...how in the hell do you charge for coke refills...$1.....seriously? You can't possibly need the money that badly! I'd give it no stars just for that reason alone. And this is coming from someone who has owned 15 restaurants at one time. So, I know the drill and rarely complain about restaurants.

l0sRfU64Sy-d-BNchrDeQQ.text: Great atmosphere. Plenty of room to play pool and other teams. The nachos are phenomenal. I always a lot of fun

XvGMdFVi3F8Ji4DpkNOEAA.text: Beautiful location by a lake. The steak sandwich is delicious and huge! Not fatty pieces and the horseradish mayo in it is very good. Also had the spinach and artichoke dip... the dip, the most important part, was very good but the chips weren't great. Waitstaff is very friendly and attentive. Also the patio is dog friendly which is very important to this dog mom.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

lp_ER0NO30phq7YK4f2frA.text: I asked for a beer with no foam and was told, by the bartender, they couldn't do that with the owner standing right next to us. I asked him for a beer with no foam and he replied "ain't gonna happen-a beer with no head is a naked beer". He added more negativity. It wasn't an unreasonable request...but the response didn't need to act like it was. I won't be back.

KIVbPhl3WqVu_febvmFL3g.text: Like seemingly every sports bar that exists, has ever existed, or will ever exist (in this reality or those realities of the alternate variety) this place is pretty average, decent, perfectly fine, OK.  I mostly come here for the trivia and to grab a beer or two.  The food is fine, typical pub fare. Nothing special or particularly impressive, but gets the job done if that's what you're looking for.  Not a place I'd go to if really wanted a nice meal and super tasty food, more of a drinking, watch a game, play some shuffleboard type of place. Same as any other sports bar.

86cINPBDN4ktzVDwbSQaqw.text: Duke's was a semi-regular hangout for me and my friends for their trivia and karaoke nights.  We were willing to overlook the meh food (seriously, their food used to better, now it's really not good), outdated decor, too loud TVs because it was fun to participate in those nights.  But after our last experience we are boycotting Duke's from now on.  We came with a group of 10 people.  From the start my friend told our server that we were going to split tabs.  NO mention from the server that she would not split our tab.  After eating my meal, I ask the server for my bill.  NO mention from the server that she would not split our tab.  End of the night there is a beer that has not been assigned to anyone's tab.  We all double-check our bills and they are all correct -- no one at our table ordered that beer.    Instead of the server thinking "hey maybe it's my mistake" (after all the restaurant had earlier tried to serve us a Dr Pepper we didn't order and a burger we didn't order.... so it's not like they've got the most organized system in the world) she shot at us "I'm bringing the manager" and stomped off.  Honestly, it was like a $4 beer.  I was about to pay for it, even though I hadn't ordered it, until the server started acting like such a brat.  Then the manager comes over and proceeds to berate us and tell us "this is why we don't split tabs for groups this big"  Me and my friends are all thinking "uhhh... okay... then why DID you?"  My friend even told the manager "we want to fix this mistake, we just want to figure out what happened."  But of course, instead of working with us to solve the problem, the manager just chooses to ignore my friend and keep lecturing.  Instead of talking back to her, which I really felt like doing, we just sat and let her talk down to us (even though we had done nothing wrong) and left and vowed never to return.  In the future we'll probably stick to going to Thirsty Lion for trivia nights.  The food is a LOT better, the atmosphere is nicer, and most importantly we've never been yelled at like we were little children when going there....  We even won a $20 gift certificate for getting 2nd place at trivia, but NONE of us are willing to go back there so looks like it will go un-used!

TOeCKzT6ZmGjaMFIYJkMjA.text: I'm at lunch at Dukes often and I enjoy the food and service. Nothing fancy but they do it right.  Great atmosphere with TVs everywhere playing your favorite sports, pool tables, etc... if your looking for a good sports bar with good food and drinks you will like this.

0ojh6yuOfBuND0UkrVsJ0w.text: I can't bring my bottle of water in because it's a health violation? Dafuq?   You can't give me both fries and tater tots with my burger? Dafuq?   Your system can't split our 3 pitchers of beer between 2 people? Dafuq?

nEKsf1QJDYu9ShuV2lChtQ.text: This place is great. I had the spicy burger (it had some clever name but I don't remember what it was) and a local draft beer. The burger was phenomenal. The service was really great the bartender Monica was really gracious.   They have Karaoke if you are into that kind of thing

FZ05l8WKfjcd0r05Qb7Wcg.text: I'm reluctant to give this review because the secret squirrel status of this place adds to the overall outstanding rating. In my opinion, the perfect sports bar. Big place with tons of tvs showing a variety of sports. Friendly and competent staff. Draft beer (and full bar). Wings and numerous other bar food options. This place is a sports fan's sports bar. If you are looking for fancy anything, just keep on moving, this isn't for you. But, if want a place to be with real people and eat real food with a cold beer (or other adult beverage of choice), then you will enjoy Duke's hospitality and straightforward offerings.

boauOmr_l8kBME6g2qvVmw.text: Cool staff, nice place and some tasty foods.  There are two parts I am having issues with however.    First they had a free driver service for many years and it says they still have it on a few pages.  Not so and I am upset they did not have the foresight to update things once they changed the service.  Secondly were their ribs.  They tasted great!  There were some disgusting fat nodules though and the bones were oddly cut.  That cut down the enjoyment however for me.

Vry3geSLhfLMp3QZn4JXLw.text: Trust me, I have all sorts of love for dive bars. But this one is just not on my list. We used to play trivia here and that was a good time. Other than that it is an easy place to pull up to on a bike off the green belt.

-AntVFwXIObTHFi1wyDCuw.text: This is one of my favorite hang out places. If you want good beer, good company, and great service this is your place. Super friendly staff, has great wings and tater tots as well as shuffle board. Great atmosphere to be in for a chill Friday night

JWAzM6tQbpXGEiNdw-PAhA.text: The service was responsive and friendly.  I love watching sporting events here. This is my number 1 place to go for watching games. Friendly and fun atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ice Berg Salad. Yum!

_qlUp2QWYBxUZiHeuqoaqQ.text: I'm not a big bar person so I didn't come for the drinks or the atmosphere. I met some friends here for drinks and something to eat. The service was really quick and I have to say I ordered a BLT and it was one of the best I've had anywhere. Also it came with coleslaw and it was really good too. Not many places get coleslaw right but Dukes did.

-PAr_nQizsYW7qEvYb3vLQ.text: I've been to Duke's a lot during my 3+ years in Scottsdale. I've drank, eaten, played trivia and had some really good times. The service and the workers are always great and have a smile on their faces.  With that being said, I went to watch Football this weekend and I saw about 5 cockroaches in and around the room I was in - on my table, on the floor and walking on the wall. I was pretty disgusted by it all, but wanted to finish watching the Pats game. I then went to take a sip of water and there was actually a fucking cockroach in my water glass. Thankfully the Pats were up because I couldn't stand to be in there any longer. I went home and showered.  Sad to say it but I will never go back.

ViddiXCU54YsW-zVqlS6UA.text: Stopped by Duke's this morning after finding positive reviews on Yelp. The food was decent enough, but I was ignored by the waitstaff after I was given my food. It took over half an hour AFTER I was finished eating to flag someone down to get my check. It would be one thing if the place was super busy, but there were only two other customers in the entire building. Definitely not worth it, and I would probably only go back if I was in a group.

DP5dMGa8xo-ip6QwaxB-7Q.text: Not a bad place, service is a bit spotty, but otherwise good.  No doubt its a huge place with a ton of TVs and good food, great place for sports fans! Cowboys fans beware!!!  Stop in and cheer for favorite team.

hKTfobcyIDrPX6AExew9Yg.text: Wrong Food Twice.  Cold food when brought back.  Poor service.  If you want wrong food but good trivia this is your place

y2Sm7_i7b2mL1grm8Akgqg.text: The food is alright here, the service is always poor, and I can't help but feel every time I come here they try to screw me outta money. Serve me a flat pitcher of beer and refuse to replace or refund it. Bad Business in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

iG4gv-Xg_ZoAw-6cGUuQpQ.text: I came in on a Wednesday night for trivia and had a pretty mediocre time. Six of my friends all met to eat, drink, and have a good time, but service kind of ruined it for us. I was sharing pitchers of beer with three other dudes and it was all I could do to get more beer. It took about thirty minutes to flag down the waitress and then get the next one delivered. Half an hour with nothing to drink. Add to that that our food took a really long time too. Now, it being trivia night i was prepared to cut the kitchen some slack... But our food came out an hour after we ordered it and it was cold. Even great food isn't that good cool cold and this was just standard bar food.  The trivia on the other hand was a high point. Their announcer is clear and repeats stuff often enough that everyone gets it. The trivia is diverse and interesting and I felt like everyone had a chance to win it. (We got third!)  Ultimately however, we brought a designated driver because we wanted to drink and we left pretty sober.

lREihoVTnQ1pAo0_KOapsQ.text: This place is a joke!!! Just went in here with my friend and her sister and ordered water with the intention of ordering food. Immediately we got carded. My friends sister is 15 years old but my friend is her legal guardian. I asked "why do we need  and ID when we are just ordering food and water". She says that's the rules. I said I've been here many times and never carded when eating and ordering food. She said well to bad that's the rules and I can grab a manager of you would like. I said yes please. She sent someone over named Mark. He didn't introduce himself as the manager but said what's the problem. We explained and he said that the rule. We said we understand that but we are ordering a water. He said that's the rule. I said you know I've been here several times and have inconsistent service. I don't understand why ordering a water props a waitress to ask for an id. He said that rule. I asked why is it when I go to Applebee's I can order food and a water and not get carded. Why can I go to Philly's down the street and do the same thing with out getting carded. He said of you don't like it then you can leave. I said I've had several issues with this place and have written bad reviews and corrected them because management has fixed the problem. But this is ridiculous. He said then why do you keep coming back if it's that bad. I said because it wasn't managements fault it was the staff but this time it's management which means that this place is dysfunctional on all levels. We walked out angry and upset and with no resolution. I believe most restaurants would have handled this much differently. I prefer to give them my business and money.  Also forgot to add It was 6:30pm when we went in not 9 where I would understand being carded.

gpPbauJY-CUSJ1TdtMZ99g.text: I love this place! My friends and I live around the block and have had more than a few good nights here. Not only are the drink specials on point, but the food is amazing as well! The hummus platter is my personal favorite but I love their salads as well. At this rate, Dukes will always remain our go-to spot :)

1QEqf1K3lMlbBhKr_SyWlg.text: First time at the bar and I was pleased. They had a different game on every TV. The waitress Bree was so nice and helpful. The best ever. And you get very large portions for your money. I will come back for sure.

aFZXcUcGTRUhAKF5o_d8Hw.text: Bar food and drinks. The staff was very nice and there are plenty of TVs to watch games.

ef-kc4U7ejTZHy7IFIfA8Q.text: Great place! Excellent service and food. Very comfortably back patio. Gone back several times

yDBtKfH0MtpHfiEMUlZHow.text: Been going to the bar and grill for 6 yrs I will never return to this place again. Today my wife and I with our lab sat on the patio had a drink and ate lunch. I got up went to the men's room came back to my table paid the bill left a tip as usual . I stood up to leave when the owner got in my face screaming at me !! He was holding a beer and you can tell he had to much to drink. He was yelling at me at the top of his lungs to get the hell out of his place and never come back. I had my side arm on my hip. Been going there with it on my hip for the last 4 yrs never had a problem . I always look for signs that say no firearms allowed . I have never seen one posted anywhere. He stood there inches from my face yelling at me. Great way to treat your customers . Screaming I don't want packers here!!!!! So I guess I'm a packer fine I am using my constructional rights. I told him if this is his he treats his clients that I'd never return. He said fine I won't let your kind in here. Then proceeded to yell get the fuck out of here!!! I turned and said don't worry I'm not ever coming back to this place. Then yelled what are you going to do ?? You wanna pull in me. I said are you fucking nuts!!! He kept screaming as I walked away.  Sad he could not had been civilized and walked up to me and said sir I guess you did not know we don't allow guns in here. Please do not bring it again. But no he had to be abusive and very mean. This is precisely the type of person I try to stay away from. Reason being they are unstable and you just don't know what they will do .  When he asked me to pull on him this told me just how disturbed this man is. He should be ashamed of himself. I wear the gun to protect myself and other people from crazy nuts like him. I respect the law and abide by the law .

qHlaSnz9GbUO3k3o5U2yUQ.text: A great neighborhood grill without pretensions and with good draft beer. Dog friendly and great patios (a smoking and a non-smoking one)!  Just wish they still had the peanut butter and jelly burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy wedge salad!

cct9mACFtlxbL40r_6QypQ.text: Service was timely. We sat in the patio to avoid the noise inside and it was perfect. The have fish and chips all the time so if you have a craving it's a perfect place.   Dog friendly patio is a plus.  Good cuts of meat cooked to order.  We will return!!

JlHGsh_NmvkSwc4N2B4eEg.text: Subpar at best. TV's are mediocre quality accompanied by claims they can't change the stations due to being pre-programmed. Until you don't want to order food then they miraculously change the channel. Either way alright chicken tenders without a good fry ration. All in all, their "America's #1 Sports Bar" banner is cause for curiosity.

Jz7NIGNZZ8Ve-Dq3FehHxg.text: Came here after flying into town on business.  The girl at the front desk of our hotel recommended this place.  There was some disc golf event going on so it was very busy.  It took about 45 minutes to get menus and waters after we had already been seated.  We ordered burgers and sandwiches and some beers.  The beers came out pretty quickly.  We waited about an hour for our food.  My French Dip was good and the burgers were good, according to my co-workers.  I cannot give this place more than three stars due to the fact that grabbing a quick bite turned into a two and a half our ordeal.

OpNIKf2BoSbpYRduVE5fWg.text: First I must say Todd is great! However the nachos are weird. I expected real cheese and it's covered in nacho cheese. No mention of this fact on the menu otherwise would not have ordered. I used to get REAL nachos here all the time. I think you should warn a person if they are about to order nacho cheese. Just sayin! Guacamole was good though, no surprises there.

2x2BTrspC0x97-3O5mJYrQ.text: Been coming to this place for years! Food is not the greatest, but the wait staff is awesome and really take care of you.  Pool tables, darts, and air hockey keep you entertained while you enjoy drinks from the bar.  Trivia seems like lots of fun, but for me, I frequent Dukes for the karaoke on Saturdays. The good Dj's allow for lots of fun all night long.  There is lots for the sports bar lover to enjoy here!

Z8tMptwFDg-0KrCTq_ILrg.text: Bigger than expected sports bar. They have games like foozeball and shuffle board which is fun. The food is okay at most. We had the chicken quesadilla and nachos. We had wanted a burger but a couple that we met there told us that they were told that all their meat comes to the, pre-cooked (which makes me look at restaurants different when they write that they can only cook medium+).  The service was bad, but I can't blame it on the servers. Even on a busy football Sunday, you seat yourself. The poor servers are running around and it takes forever to get anyone's attention and to get anything.   Oh... And the no specials on Sunday / during football game is another negative.

RHqMZOMlKahoDPdH2RoiFg.text: Great food, burger was awesome!  Sirloin salad-fantastic!  Friendly staff, 18 year anniversary party, Marley Taylor rocked the house with live music!  This place has it all, sports, patio, dance floor and super menu!

8mElOkyJrb0fkKsF6rJEcg.text: They have the game on in the bathroom. That's some great service right there. Good beers, great food. Chill atmosphere.

rSAU2e6l6DPa4r0IWllyMg.text: I've come to Duke's a lot for carryout orders later in the evening, probably 50 plus orders. They are open during hours many places are closed which I love.   However, while they claim the kitchen closes at midnight, bar at 1AM, the last couple times I've called in they've closed the kitchen well ahead of midnight. This gets frustrating as a frequently returning customer who enjoys their select group of late-night food options.  I will no longer be going to Duke's because of this, sadly. They have some good food options and their attempt to be available later in the evening is wonderful but inconsistent.

nFWdOmh0KRMqcADeyjzgOQ.text: Great place. The Duke burger is very good alone with the tater tots.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. First time at Dukes in quite some time. Great burgers.

BQZ_YE3Vs-LUfQ_xLb4-gQ.text: Good local spot! No complaints... always decent food and good prices. Waitresses don't know how to play trivia which kinda made it more confusing but still figured it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

skkuTCaRnWvWDEVO_h1A4A.text: Stopped in this place as it was very close to my hotel. Had an Ice Cold Beer, and good service at the bar area. In addition as it was Monday night they were doing a special on their basic burger or a pork tenderloin sandwich for $4.00.  I chose the PTS and it was pretty good, not amazing mind you, but tasty and the price sure was right. It was served with nice crisp and hot fries, and it hit the spot perfectly. I would recommend this place if you are looking for a quick bite to eat and a cold drink. Plenty of TV's as well for your sports watching needs.

cDsNNF1igYx1UDYAPIQi5Q.text: Tonda was amazing!! She was so friendly and kind while I came for football Sunday. She was training Amber on her first day and Amber was so awesome. Attentive, funny, quick and sweet. I could not ask for a better duo to take care of me and my friends. If you come in here ask for these two. I don't write many reviews about the food industry, but these ladies deserve it.

Zo54pxBEFBlAZtPqWdH2qg.text: In for an after work drink and dinner. I give it a very good review because it checked all the boxes for what I expected, a good sports bar.  The place is huge, tables to the left, bar in the middle and two rooms with table and games to the right. What i appreciated about it is that it isn't too dark, and since they play the audio or one of the games on it isn't too loud. Too hot to enjoy the large patio but will be out there once it cools down. The TV's, ohhh the TV's, they are everywhere. I loved the wall of tv's because I could zero in on the game I wanted to watch and easily check in on it. The number and visibility of the TV's is one thing that makes this a step above other sports bars in the area.  The service was great. Our waitress was Aubrey and she was working hard for her tables. She was not just pleasant but also had a good sense of humor also.   I'm in a sports bar so I'm expecting good sports bar food, and they met that expectation. The Patty Melt is one of the better patty melts I've had and adding Tots as a side is a bonus. The Nachos were large, tasted like homemade chips and a good amount of beef. The half order of Chicken Cesar was large enough for a single menu.  Would I go back? Yes, and I will!

9juvdbeXhSKTUm39U5KFRg.text: If you in South scottsdale or rocky point this is a good spot.  The salsa are surprisingly really good here.  Nice drink selection, lots of games to play, tvs everywhere and daily specials.  My favorites are the Buffalo chicken salad and the nachos with verde chicken.

vgW-t_kIOwmsq_KsJNKLDQ.text: Just went to Dukes to try their rib special. I was very disappointed- they were fatty and not good at all. Two other people at the table had some that looked a bit better. After pointing it out to the waitress, she said she would tell the manager. If that really happened, the manager did NOT come to our table nor did they discount the meal at all. My advice: skip Dukes and go someplace else

sx_-3vPPzczfJWnk7lusyA.text: Shout out to Crow! Finally well done fries -first time in Area! Great burger -best service ask for Rebecca but vibe tells me they are all great employees Linda and Bear

XD-AyuyijQ2YT-KRlW530A.text: Service is slow......food was better than average but nothing really special. Location is great with the park so close. The service turned me off a bit.

mtuJGTkHtCYmNz1gLCFHsA.text: This place was a blast.  The drinks keep flowing and the crowd was amazing. My bartender Monica was super nice and she can sing too!!!  It was Karaoke Thursday... I had so much fun with almost 56 televisions, who wouldn't love this place!!!  I'll be back at Duke's real soon.....real soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blue Moon!!! It better have my orange slice!!

yaw5ixillKtBMFFi8-F8iQ.text: So, stopped in for lunch today. First time, and the last time.  Sat at the bar, service was good.  $3 for ice tea, my brother also ordered an ice tea. Another $3.   I asked for a refill, Jackie States $1 refill. For damn ice tea.  Tell you what, the minimum wage law kills business, but for lunch, $31 dollars later (chicken strips and a club sandwich) I'll frequent other places in the area.  $7 for tea. Unreal.

0QTLsmKUGH341wchb1T4gA.text: The staff was personable and attentive, even when the Steelers lost AFC Championship :( Bartender has a good pour and drink prices seemed little less than base price of "call liquor" in Scottsdale.  The food I did sample was just good enough, not great. All in all though super chill, where nice people wait on nice people who come together for fun, food and drink!

BKL1DpmuKXdM6zi8SY81Jw.text: We came here for dinner after we had school open house. We ordered food. 2 of us got moldy bread sandwiches. We told them about the mold... They fixed the sandwiches with new ones...didn't give us anything off the bill after the 2 of them are half of the sandwich. Hope they dont get sick and we need to call the doctor because they have food poisoning.  They let us fill out a bunch of birthday cards...you get $10.00 off your bill on your birthday.    Yay!!  Free mold...

8uwyzLHTXxrLzytYkU5QSQ.text: Dukes mails me out a Free Appetizer ( $ 10) for my Birthday . When I go in they Refuse to honor it .Show them my Drivers License . Still Refuse . It's Ok , will NEVER set foot in the place Again ! Save me from spending $ 500 on $6 IPA during Football season . Thank you Dukes for saving me $$$$ this Fall

6HxkMpLH2EnlB2aG1pXhNg.text: Listen... as often as I am here I am extremely disappointed that within the last few months, there is no longer late night snacks and a bar that is open until 2:00... "last call" is 12:30... I would rather go to Well Bar or Philly's... Beyond the fact that I want to be there late night, I feel bad for the awesome staff that are losing out on great money, SAD. Dukes does well because people go for the staff, friendly atmosphere and all of the other great things that they have going for them. Maybe if they stayed open a little later, I would reconsider it being my favorite local watering hole.

BmkJYOdgJ9z-PwaFwXGdPw.text: We were very pleasantly surprised when we had lunch here last Thursday. The bartender was super friendly and attentive and our food was delicious! Very good experience!
