y-c2WTE_8jz1rTXa6YgjbA.text: Absolutely LOVE dukes! Come in a few times a week and have the best time with my girl friend. Staff members are extremely nice and food and drink prices are reasonable!

9ksTwsw2sr-TAWpf24VjRg.text: Another bad experience. Sat at the bar, not very busy on a Tuesday night(9/11). There were two guys tending bar and neither one bothered to ask if I wanted a beer.  After 5 minutes I left. This has happened twice before and it's always the same bartender. Customer service is awful. The owner was sitting at the bar but he was too drunk to notice the poor service. This place has lots of potential if they could find new bartenders.

_lq4vqOQrCRmHCGVNOXH0Q.text: I've ridden my bike here with friends and lunched on the non-smoking patio a few times. I always order the Reuben and have never been disappointed. The service is good and the waitresses are friendly.  I just learned that both patios are dog friendly, as long as the dogs are leashed.  I'll add Duke's to my list of Dog Friendly establishments. Peekaboo is going to be happy to hear that.

3iKVQgSHAlQGJBCclbREhA.text: This is what you call a real sports bar. TVs are lining the place with every sport showing on tv. There's a wide range of seating inside and on the outside patio. There's darts, pool, shuffle board, arcade games, and probably more. Friendly staff and good service. The food is your average bar food with reasonable prices. It's a great place to unwind and catch a game. Bonus... They have a giant sign above the bar that reads "Cowboys Suck".

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. TVs galore

XRWKl30mMtKQt5a6ibF70A.text: This place is a lot of fun, attentive staff, cheap (or free) pool. Reasonably prices drinks!

_rcTcIeh9bHVgMSZEAjcIQ.text: Great sports bar. You can get any game u want. Food is above average for bar food and large menu. Great activities. Trivia, karaoke, buck hunter, pool n darts...

SbvXf2v7u56dOFstOKdFig.text: Rude waitresses. Bad service. Microwave tasting food. Seems like it would be fun if the food didn't taste like garbage and the help was pleseant. It smelIs bad inside, kind of like vomit. I love dive bars but this place has taken it too far. I will never ever go to this place again and I would not send my worst enemy there. May God have mercy on Duke's soul.

CwlVsJryJmJkWN83-vAzew.text: I've had fun hanging out here, especially since it's walking distance from the apartment. However, the beer selection and food menu are mediocre... With so many craft breweries popping up in the Easy Valley, it's hard to justify not supporting local breweries, especially when some of these local breweries also offer awesome menus.

Cov2CKAdoy3e85gqmf4D-w.text: Oh what's to say about Duke's that hasn't already been said. I've had some really great times here over the years AND there've been some times that I wish my friends would just let me forget already.  Karaoke, build your own bloody mary, $6 pitchers and rock -n- roll nachos are all part of why I never mind coming here.  One word of caution, though, if you're drinking said $6 pitchers, it's probably flat beer and not too fresh. Often times, you can see a server dipping a straw into the pitcher and briskly giving the beer a stir, causing it to "head" up a bit before bringing it to your table. But it's piss beer anyway, so you pretty much get what you pay for.  My favorite times coming here are during games in which hometown teams are doing well and the owner gives away free shots. Also, the patio is nice during the winter.  Oh yeah, free car ride home if you're too hammered to drive. So please tip the driver!  Cheers!

TlLB_svEU9mI3Xdx_p3uQQ.text: I've been going to Duke's for a long time. The service is decent and the food is average. But recently something made me decide never to go again.  A few weeks ago, I was sitting at the bar and I noticed that there was one girl there who is an LA Kings fan. It was the night that the Kings eliminated the Coyotes from the playoffs. She was (needless to say) excited. She didn't appear drunk, nor was she obnoxious nor taunting the many Coyotes fans. However, I witnessed the owner demand her to leave. I felt this was unfair, as it seemed the only reason he had was simply because she was cheering for the opposing team.  I've been to Dukes when the Lakers were the star attraction, so you can't tell me that this is an "Arizona" bar. She was treated unfairly. Period.  Because of this fact,I will not be back. There are far too many other sports bars (with better food, better service, and may I say better hospitality).

AqiGYL8lEgr5pXr-sd1VlQ.text: From my door, it's a five minute stroll through the greenbelt to Dukes. They have a nice patio. They have enough TVs to show all MLB/NFL/NBA games. They have plenty of shuffleboard and pool tables. Yet, I've only been to Duke's a few times and I am not going back. This place is just bad.  Mixed drinks use cheap mixers (such as bottled sour mix for margaritas). They offer a pretty basic beer selection at a rather high price point. I think PBR pitchers might be more modestly priced, but that might be only when they're on special.  The food is pretty bad, even for bar food. And pricey. Sure, the menu is gigantic and I've tried many different items, but I didn't find anything good. Everything seems to be made from freezer-to-fryer or packaged products. I'm not exaggerating: the burger and fries for about $8 is a thin, previously frozen patty with a handful or supermarket fries. I could go on about salads, sandwiches, and ribs. In the same price range, you can get a much better version of anything on the menu at Four Peaks or Zipps or even Devil's Advocate.  One of the owners was there on a few occasions. I guess being the boss of (and drinking in) his own bar is some sort of dream of his. He treats the place like his kingdom. He'll ask patrons "how is everything?" and get mad at them if they have anything negative to say. I feel bad for the rest of the service staff; they seem to be above average, but when the overall situation is this bad it just doesn't matter.  In this city, sports bars are a dime a dozen. I'd rather go elsewhere.

z7B8fHiW00oaT_CutcD8EA.text: My boyfriend plays softball games down the street from Dukes, and we have made it a new tradition to come here after every game. Win or Lose. It's fun and convenient for his teammates and the fans to have a beer or some food after the games which in the summer league made us all very thirsty!   You would probably never see Duke's from the street or think there could be anything worth while in this strip mall but Duke's is a buried treasure. It's a dive bar so don't get your hopes up to high, but they have great drink specials and very friendly and fast staff.   Fall league is starting at the end of September on Tuesdays so Duke's is where I'll be Tuesday nights after the games!

h2wFJfG3WN4kol9Js4EISQ.text: Went for lunch at 11:40 am.  Saturday, today.  The menu items were off limits, but could have breakfast and all the appetizers, until 12 noon.  Really? Sales prevention team.

Ykl-NrOPK7N-PyufIh0C6w.text: A group of us went here Friday night to watch the Stanley Cup Final- and like another reviewer we were told to go to the pool room to watch the game. So we finished our drinks and went to Max Sports Grill. Love the fact that Dukes is on the green belt and very close to home- but really disappointed when we were told by our waitress that the owner hated hockey and he feels it doesnt bring in business so he refuses to put it on with sound in the main bar. Well it brought 6 of us in and we left because of the owner's personal preference (and we still had a couple more people that were going to join us).   I think it is safe to say for our group that next time we will just go straight to Max's

x5Gi1ymOJZsyLeXMsbRvMA.text: Arrived at 11:30 on a Wednesday and ordered promptly.  It took 30 minutes for a salad and a french dip (and they weren't very busy).  The fries were cold.  The sandwich was cool.  The au jus was hot enough to burn my lip, thereby rendering the whole thing inedible until it cooled.  The ranch was so runny it was like water.  And, to top it off, got a touch of food poisoning.  Won't ever go back!

OeacCanjb7ChnmnRmMBYUg.text: I come out to Scottsdale every year in March for one weekend, to do two things: to watch spring training baseball and watch the opening rounds of NCAA March Madness all day at Dukes.  And it's heaven.  The service at Dukes is friendly and attentive, they have good bar food, and a bloody mary station to get you going in the mornings.  They have more tvs set up than you could possibly ever need, with multiple rooms that cut you off from the main bar area so you or a group can watch your own game on a big screen with volume.  It's a real sports bar that knows how to run it's tvs and put the best games on.  They have multiple pool tables, buck hunter and shuffle board.

bDDdtICtO-52Noh9j3EtYg.text: Although we've been here many times in the past (and enjoyed the experience), I was very disappointed to see the menu recently has been streamlined.  The server told us that someone new is now running the kitchen, and has simplified the menu to focus on quality.  Not impressed.  The hamburger that I order came on a kaiser roll that tasted as though it had been pulled out of a bag of rolls.  The "pound" of wings that my son ordered cost us $11...can find less expensive and better wings at BWW, Zipp's or even Barro's Pizza.  Very disappointed with these changes in food quality and pricing.  To add insult to injury, we were there today on  NFL opening weekend.  The place was packed, which added to a wait time of over 30 minutes for pretty mediocre food.

o9uEnZg9RNmnEAQ5N6CiRQ.text: Zipps or Twin Peaks ... Much better sports bars. Way cuter staff, way better food, and much friendlier guests.  Got asked to leave because I'm a fan of a team other than Arizona!  Owner (Al) and bar manager (Mike) are useless jerks. Totally rude and unaccommodating if you're a fan of anyone besides Arizona.  Oh, and sports fans beware: they do BINGO on Thursday nights. God forbid you want to watch a game that night without hearing "Beeee... Eighteen.... Beeeee... Eighteen...."

nPuA0JAlzsPM_aMQjeRbfw.text: We went here for dinner the other night.  It was busy but not packed.  One of us ordered a burger (special of the day) and the other fish and chips (a regular menu item).  It took 40 minutes to get our food.  Reason:  we are geared up for cooking burgers tonight not fish and chips.  Really!!!  So if you order something other than the special of the day, it is going to take forever to get you meal. Won't be back anytime soon......besides, their prices on regular items have gone up considerably in the past year or so......

hryPzM0V6hy_sFVhoCLSuA.text: So, I called to place a To-Go order and the staff member that answered said they were to busy to take the order....  Remind me to not call them in the future and to spend my money somewhere else.  Ridiculous.

skzfv670HWwFIjFv2mOAMg.text: No stars even though the wings are very good.   Are they worth 12$ per order of 10 ?  I don't think so.  We went in to watch a game. Just me and my two boys.  Each had a order of wings and fries.  They kept bringing us refills throughout the game (not telling us they were a 1$ each for refills.  Over all for some wings and fries  and multiple refills that were a DOLLAR each , our bill for lunch of wings and fries was over 65$.  Are you FUCKING shitting me ?  Service was slow at best.    It's such a shame.   Good wings just to get shit on.    Don't think I'll return for that kind of abuse.

GehguGlPpyvwWRhO8cS3AQ.text: Greatest sports bar in PHX and maybe the world.  COWBOYS SUCK is written above the bar.  TVs everywhere, tolerable food, and a great make it yourself Bloody Mary bar on the weekends.  Dog friendly, cool staff. Awesome park right there also.

KgVwTF4cNIRsDARxF3WLWg.text: Regular sports bar with a couple of unique amenities.  Large patio on the Scottsdale greenbelt.  Menu where every sandwhich has a corresponding salad version (essentially replace the bread with lettuce).  Lots of specials, and a fun birthday offer.  It's quite large with multiple sections, and televisions all around.

1qPvY86jdbUfdKfgZwQTTg.text: I used to come here a lot about 8 years ago. I loved all the staff and the food so I figured it wasn't going to be much different and was excited to be back. However my server Paula wasn't very attentive and didn't seem to care. I am a server and a bartender and have been for 10 years so I know the industry very well. She didn't seem happy and I had to get her attention to call her over numerous times, she never asked how our food was; which we didn't like (we got the chicken fingers). I asked for 2 things of blue cheese and 1 more ranch for the chicken before we tried it, they cost .75 each mind you; we tried the chicken and didnt like it so we asked for something else which she got for us but still charged us for the dipping sauce we didn't even use. I think she should have taken them off my bill since they never got used, but I guess she needed the money. I left her a 15% tip when I shouldn't have left anything, the service wasn't good and the food wasn't good. If I ever do come back I'll just sit at the bar and make sure I eat before I come.

us-DMCKgt8TfDvoAWpDLRA.text: I will try to be constructive with my critique of this place.   The food was average.   I did not care for the zucchini.  The Philly Cheese Steak did not have much flavor.  Everything tasted like frozen microwave food.   Furthremore, the service was not very good.   Our server was very forgetful and non-attentive to us.   I have no reason to ever come to this place again.   I will not provide a recommendation for this place.

WsFfhqkDVN6G2hJHHJ7Zhg.text: Good sports bar.  It was Thurs and they ran out of the rib special.  Salad was good.! Beers are cold.

0MYjzWYdGIp9-9JKSDHaQw.text: This sports bar is a real sports bar with a menu that has your awesome bar food with other healthy options. I am gluten free and had the best BBQ bacon cheeseburger that had a gluten free bun! It was so amazing! The staff is friendly and the drinks are always on the ready!

8Nw-UvYnRiDpFOkin1qv8w.text: Come here after kickball all the time! The food is good and the beer is grand. It's a small hole-in-the-wall but it is fun.

tLSZ9HltVryO_RCdiSCStg.text: This place is huge and has so many TVs that every sports fan should be satisfied. Food is excellent, even have breakfast on weekends for the early games! It's right on the park and has a beautiful outside patio

rP-MVhIGuR5DZlLHa3Akaw.text: Used to be our favorite sports bar but last time we had a waitress with a bad attitude and was not even cute, looks like a meth head!! Dont they know if they hire good looking girls with a pleasant attitude, they will get more customers, going elsewhere, dont need service with an attitude!!

_Y2mnMdPBAQDqm8D7ZS2VQ.text: They have an all new menu, totally fresh! No more freezer food, and they have Orange Shandy on tap! I'm in heaven!!!

3aQ0h9lv9Gy_bEExhMji1Q.text: Great sports bar.  Plenty of seating, plenty of tvs, and dog friendly patio.  Nice selection on menu with daily specials, they sometimes run out of menu items which isn't cool but there are plenty of other good selections.  Try the chicken breast with mashed potatoes and green chili gravy...yum.

o0j5Bk0qjkh5HEg-MH9RRg.text: Perfect place to watch a game with friends on the weekend, or to just grab a beer or two after work. Love the laid back atmosphere. Pool tables, darts and shuffle boards are a great touch to this place. Thumbs up to their bloody Mary bar.....delishious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Go Ducks

2gE5qnnBpPI6wP8F4lk_Yg.text: We came in to watch the GRIZ play as the owner is from Montana. This place is dingy, dirty, and has horrible service. I've never been to a bar that charges for refills. Not a fan of this place. Not sure why people come back.

O7K9Pl8rVO0037KkMvUEBw.text: Always fun and the food is great! Family used to come here all the time, especially for trivia nights lol.

puxOtoZePMd0oVLj3cNF6A.text: This is a great all-around "go to" place. You want to grab a bite or a cold one with a old friend, or a (very) casual first date with a new someone? Tastey food, reasonable prices, decent service, sports all over the place, pool in the back. In a town where douchebag nightclubs come and go faster than imaginable, theres a reason why Dukes remains.

HDoUzaPhQn9a-ClVDG2rJA.text: It's up and it's good!  The best sports bar in town.  Friendly service, fairly priced food, excellent game day atmosphere.

oc7-kWXJ_DAQ8emcrmdt9Q.text: What's not to love? Outdoor patio where my dog hung out while we watched football, great drink prices, yummy sandwiches and we really loved the wings! We are visiting from out of town and we like it so much we will be back for MNF tonight.

27o465Q4bNHycidv4h1XfA.text: If I could give less than 1 star I would. I just moved here from another state and decided to try Duke's for dinner. Instead of having dinner, my night was ruined. As we sat down the waitress asked us what we wanted to drink. Everyone at the table ordered water. She then asked for ID because "you have to be 21 to be in here". She did not say "21 or with an adult or guardian". She wouldn't serve us or even discuss what our situation was without sending a manager over. I am 25 and legal guardian of my 16 year old sister who was with us (she was the only under aged person). sitting next to us are two adults with their young child. The manager, Mark, was 10x worse than the waitress. He was a smart ass and after hearing our issue, he laughed and said "why do you come here then". This place is absolutely awful. Never in my life have I been treated this way at ANY customer service based place of business. Disrespectful, out of line, judgmental and rude don't even begin to touch on the service we got here.

TGssMZTWLWacQo7FVuzyVg.text: Hidden in a random strip mall, there's a good chance plenty of people pass Dukes without realizing that they are missing out. Now, this is a dive bar so like all other dive bars, you have to take it for what it is. The floors could be shinier, the bathrooms could be cleaner, but then it wouldn't be an authentic dive bar would it?  Duke's is a solid choice when looking for a place to play some bar games, watch sports and enjoy some drinks. It's spacious and great for large groups. You name the game, they've got it: several pool tables, darts, shuffle board, Foosball, etc. TVs line the walls with your favorite sport teams playing. With the reasonably priced drinks, this is a good place to pregame before a sporting event or set up shop and watch it on TV.   I've hosted a party at Dukes and it's a perfect location because of the size, TVs, games and most importantly, because they don't charge to rent out the party room. So, you can have up to 100 people in a party room without any fees! And, for a girl on a budget trying to throw a low key party, this was a perfect choice.   So I suggest Dukes if you are looking for a dive bar night on the town and you don't want to just sit around when you get there.

sh6_UGsy1LRMWKfg2iDDJg.text: Great place to go play pool! They have nice tables, shuffleboard, and TV's. The service is great. The food is pretty good for bar food. The nachos are on point! They have a nice patio outside. If you are into frisbee golf there is a great course right next door. You can stop in for a beer halfway through the game if you want. They have good happy hours. The best part is they give you a free ride home if you had a couple too many! They do pool tournaments from time to time and they are always doing specials on the weekends.

Ym3fKbDZwOYwogcYOCq8jw.text: Last visit was a vast improvement... It is always based on the level of service.  It was really cool to see a bunch of military recruits there- always a plus.  The guy at the table next to us snagged their bill before we could - an indication of the caliber of people that frequent the place.  The server will make or break your experience - the food is good, the atmosphere is great for family, friends and/or a great night out however the experience is contingent on the service...  the park behind the place is a great view too.

n59AVDQ8PMBzyBZYlNRN6A.text: Stopped in as it was across the street from where we were staying. We ordered bloody Mary's, which were very watered down and the only garnishment they provided was one green olive (no chaser either). We also ordered the chicken finger appetizer, which was disgusting.. My first bite, had to be discarded as it had a chewy/rubbery texture.  We decided to give them another chance that evening and stopped in for a beer. The bartender had a pitcher sitting on top of the counter which she used to make his drink, she then topped it off from the keg (probably to add foam and keep it a little cool).  Lastly, they have a tub with bottles of beers, I assume to should be filled with ice however in this case the ice melted and it was just sitting in water (which I would assume is not keeping them at the right temp). Another bartender decided to put their hand in the tub to swirl the water around and then proceeded to help a customer.

ZnnVOwX2cqebfzlssIObXg.text: If you like subpar bar food and service that takes forever, come to Duke's.  The one redeeming quality is the dog friendly patio, it's a pretty large patio as well. Inside there are tons of tvs, pool tables and they even do trivia multiple nights a week.   When I've eaten here however, I haven't really been that impressed. I've always never chosen this place, my friends did because they live walking distance from it. Duke's a 2.75 Star restaurant to me... not awful but definitely not something worth traveling for.

E0Tp1u6WxjV4PdE10zb5ew.text: Great place to seat next to the park! Food is good. Lots of tv's for watching sports. Pool table and shuffle board. A big patio with smoke and non smoking patio

BIbOHkwpM-OH1qlhr3pUbg.text: Who is warming up to Dukes? This guy!  Been in more frequent and I must say the place is looking great. Updates to TVs to start and the staff is on point. Great/ quick/friendly service all make me rethink why I haven't been hanging out here more often.  I really like the food, everything has been great in the last few months, but my favorite dish is the shrimp platter.

FFc2QHTMad236LN0IF0GoQ.text: Nothing to write home about. Been there 4ever & got sucked in by burger special. Typical bar food & musty dive. Thx but no...

eZphVPRYvMjBxn17ho4_kw.text: Fun place to stop off after playing around in the park. Their great Bloody Marry bar keeps us coming back!

Z55x2dK1feIxKhkTQVAA3w.text: I found a place that reminds me of home.. it's a 'local regular' semi-dive bar that offers daily specials, pool tables, trivia nights and friendly service! We decided to try them out for Game 2 of the World Series (TVs line the walls/ceilings so you won't miss a view regardless where you sit) and to try our hand at trivia night. Dinner was good- nothing over-the-Top great, but I ordered the BBQ chicken salad ($9 for any salad Wednesday), and my friend orders the buffalo chicken sandwich, which looked delicious. The nachos have actual nacho cheese on them, so I'd likely pounce on that and their wings when we go back. Trivia was a solid time- starts at 7:30pm and lasts about 2 hours. The highlight of our night was our waitress, Tonda. She was involved in our conversation and attentive to what we needed. She also was nice enough to bring us birthday cards to send to ourselves for $10 off on our bdays next year! They also have a cute patio we want to try out now that the weather is getting nice.

4kr84TBv5xeb2au-eCH0bQ.text: Great food, cheap alcohol. We sat at the bar and had great service from the bartender. He gave us each a shot of his making. It was great. The well vodka was Finlandia which I love. We went on one of the karaoke night. I can see why people say poor service; the waitress was drunk and singing karaoke. I've been there multiple times and have always had great food and that's why we keep going back....except their fries. Don't do the fries, just average.

EVeYEJ2cjHCv5c2cLVS1ug.text: Large dive bar, service is brutal & drinks are mediocre. Spicy chicken sandwich was blah,  sliders were ok,  tater tots were forgotten but arrived hot & REALLY greasy.

4NT5oV0y2CkJrm2gj0YAaw.text: I usually like this place but tonight I had the worst prime rib I have ever had. Only 1/4 inch thick and over 50 % fat. Waitress was very nice and and apologized for extremely poor cut of meat. She said manager was going to stop by our table but he evidently didn't care. Will never order that again

3RVt3kYRMssEqpFxoDQQwQ.text: Will not be back.. Been there many times. Many yes ago when it was High Tops we were there all the time with great service and decent prices.. But not the story now..Time after time bad service.. The manager was very nice and covered part of our tab after we waited 25 min to be served cold wings and a sandwich..the fried were hot ok..  Anyway. We've had enough..  sorry we really DID like Dukes..

rGp8aAiNead9puHOBL9tWw.text: If you want pointers at this place, then read this...went there for a burger, also someone in our party had a salad. Let me start by warning you that any little extra you want, your gonna pay !!! These kind of restaurants really piss me off !! I'm surprised they didn't charge us for straws. Now let me say that the burger and salad tasted very good. The salad ( cob salad ) was very small for $12, I could of ate 3 of them. They give you a pathetic amount of salad dressing and if you want more ? BAM ! .75 cents un-fricken real. Refill on a tiny glass of coke ? BAM ! $1.00. These kind of business owners should stay out of the business altogether, not to mention, 2 of our 3 orders were not correct, not pleased !!!! And not returning.

vi6EpaBlB1BaLyD9NDm9OA.text: I'm sad this definitely will be my last visit to dukes. Nothing wrong with the food or service*. Little mess but very promptly fixed. Wished she would have told us about the .75 and .50 extra charges would have happily done with our bc totally not necessary esp when a pound (9) wings were 12$...... 9 wings, 1/2 order of fries and a pitcher of beer with tip 35$. Not worth it in my opinion

BZ8j6043XCFzLzwUSI62NA.text: Cool layout. Food wasn't great. But the TV setup for all the games was pretty cool. Service was friendly as well

A-WeOpAmxJ37mTvFVDg49Q.text: Food and drinks always on point!  Miles and the staff are always amazing and make for a great experience!  Keep up the good work

1RxC3SEpX7uyMtv0OVxx8A.text: This dive bar is in the corner of Miller and Mcdowell in a strip mall.Don't be fooled by its shabby exterior this place is Huge with tons of tv's,pool tables,darts and what not. They also have outdoor seating and a smoking patio.  During the day service is slow even when the place is empty. ~Fish and chips $12 served with coleslaw and tartar sauce. ~Buffalo chicken $10 served with a side of tater tots.  I was definitely not a fan of the fish and chips the fish wasn't even fried in a batter and the slaw tasted funny.The buffalo chicken however was delicious,it was an open face burger with lettuce,tomatoes & red onions.The chicken was tender and grilled to perfection also had some heat from the buffalo sauce.  I would say go if you're a fan of dive bars,watch a game or play some pool just not for the food.  Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish and chips $12.
Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Buffalo chicken with tater tots $10.

EEa7Ynnd1pi0iFoZklOubA.text: I'm not much of a bar guy but I really enjoy coming here. The atmosphere is laid back and has a varied mix of patrons. They have all of your classic bar games and although sometimes busy, there is always something open for you to play. Drinks are priced fairly and the bartenders work hard for their tips. I'll be back again.

iOTrukP6vLxCLdjEY7M70Q.text: Staff here is super friendly, they're a nice in between of not overbearing and tentative. Food is the common bar food, patio is nice overlooking the green belt and is dog friendly. Pricing is reasonable and it's a nice neighborhood bar!

VvzLHGZxrccHLs-pPTHLOA.text: Great TVs for sporting events, great patio and great food. Wings are great and they probably have 50+ TVs with pool tables, darts, etc.

B2KdL4Wy2Emr6M3APpaAWQ.text: Daily food specials are very reasonably priced for the quality of food offered.  Very relaxing patio area in back with smoking and non-smoking areas.  Good assortment of beers offered.  Service could be a little faster, but overall a very nice sports bar.

c4Ryvk0tZiOcXLZ7qVt9CA.text: This place has decent coverage of the games. Waited what seemed like for 50 minutes for nachos. Let's get it together.

E1FdQFmLmt3xS_hDCsgDrw.text: Great inside area. Great outside patio! Great steak sandwich and terrific staff always friendly!

mxtNHBg2GJnb7kwwpkqKOA.text: This is your typical sports bar with mediocre fried food options, but it is great for watching the game as they have a plethora of televisions. They could use to clean it up a little bit as it feels a little dirty. However the owner loves to give out free shots when his teams play.

afZm4WfkVgufjNJ_c_Arnw.text: Well so far this is my favorite spot to go. Staff is friendly, even to me. And food is good, California burger with potato salad. My new go to food.

XSMD7a-N5YtPqCROcWMKWA.text: It is just down the street from me but as far as food goes it is just okay...  The reason the rating is so low is due to the fact that we were there to watch the Finally Four and during the same time they decided to also make it trivia night?!? It seemed that everytime one of the teams would make a break they would also be yelling out another question, totally a distraction. Not a good move for a SPORTS bar.

TPDrTgT_zQ_drTHvaJe4aQ.text: Accidentally stopped in on my way to the mountains. .what a wonderfully fun accident it was!..I enjoyed great food,people,laughter, and fun...I played darts,pool...and absolutely enjoyed the atmosphere here...I will make it a planned dinner and fun place to hang in the future..fabulous!

CcZP1L4BWfrYm6QUHJ9fnA.text: Wow...I've never been to such an unpleasant place in my life. First of all, it took 30 minutes for us to even see our waitress. She took our orders another 30 minutes after finally bringing our drinks, Then brought our food an hour after that. Our order was completely wrong and some of our food didn't even come out till 2 hours after it was ordered. Our waitress was rude and had no idea what she was doing. The manager wasn't helpful at all either. I definitely do not recommend ever going here...I know I never will again.

sV0k62xg1OJDqmDN9IWKWQ.text: Holy Moley Duke's - What a crowd for the first Sunday of the NFL Season. I know you open at 9:30 and by 10:00 there was barely a seat in the place. Loved the way you set up the rooms with various games on the larger screens and that Bloody Mary Bar was perfect. This place was hopping and the service couldn't have been better. We had breakfast steak and eggs. The rib-eye was fantastic and the eggs were cooked as ordered. The potatoes were pretty sad though - sorry Duke's. They tasted like they had been sitting in a pot for quite some time. Drinks were cold and like I said, the set-up was really good. They even covered the pool tables to make extra seating for fans. I'd come back here for sporting events but I would get here MUCH MUCH earlier!!

nmeAhX9MvkePFtJ_ay58XA.text: Trivia night at Duke's is one of the highlights of my week. It's a great excuse to hang out at Duke's and eat some of their great food. They have quite the menu and I always have a tough time choosing what to get. I typically go with the sandwich and soup combo, but the salads are awesome too. Service is hit or miss, but not bad enough to keep me from coming back every week for trivia night :)

w-Wo_2fuao7022PGjnhEJQ.text: Watched the Cardinals game here today. Super crowd, breakfast burrito was delicious.  Our server Brandy, was attentive but not hovering. Al, the owner is passionate and fun loving!  Key: don't be a tight ass with a shitty attitude and you will have a great time!

uSUSUTg4dRKiwbhvsqvXfw.text: Literally, was here for 2 hours before everyone at the table got their food. Server was rude, manager was rude. The manager Marcia literally said "I can do a cart wheel and the splits". I felt mocked, I came here for awesome bar trivia with Darrell, but unfortunately I won't be back. Hopefully the manager and the serving staff gets their act together.

g5Z4sT11ymZdcMSvP4iE_w.text: Horrible,horrible service and supremely overpriced food. $11 for 10 tiny wings? Really?

65rUA55f4FJSgiS9Ec_UBQ.text: I used to really love this place but its getting more and more expensive and the service in the tables is slacking sometimes. Good game coverage but the prices are steep.

FPI4lzM_cYnf-OOBq6dCkg.text: When I first moved into Scottsdale from Tempe I wanted a dive bar next to my house like I always had in Tempe.  For 3mos I didn't even know Dukes existed!  Luckily I finally found my way over into the random strip mall it's tucked into and checked it out.  So....the most important thing other than beer? Fried food.  And there's is amazing!  Fried zucchini was d'lish!  I also noticed that they had a ton of games on the other side of the bar that I didn't have a chance to check out.  I have only been once so far but I can guarantee it won't be my last !  It's about to be cruiser season and you better believe I'll be recruiting friends to ride cruisers over, eat amazing fried food, drink beers and play games!  Let's get the fall/winter kicked off right! Am I right? :)

kPfgEb-pEBTs4MNpnpoA7g.text: Dukes Well Vodka got me sick?? I never get sick from drinking, if you go there Don't order any well Drink from Dukes. I called management after getting sick and to let them know they might have bad well Vodka, and the Manager Al kept making excuses on how I got sick and started to argue with me. He didn't even say sorry. I won't be going to Dukes any more and if you go there hopefully you don't get sick too, Jaime!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

-gdDYpskD4_snAjghTNXuQ.text: Awesome place for sports watching! Better than any other place, besides being at the game live.   They have tons of TVs, no way I could count them all. Around 50 or so if I had to guess. If you post yourself up at the bar you have at least 8 right in front of you, perfect for watching multiple games at a time. Now if you only had more eyes to spread around then you would be set.   Their food menu is huge too, something for everyone. Great appetizers/finger food, awesome sandwiched and 30 different salad for the healthy minded. The Reuben and Ahi tuna salad are a few of my faves.   The bar backs up to the golf course so you have a great view while sitting on the back patio. Like I said there is something to entice anyone.   Word of advise: if you are a Cowboys fan, DO NOT go here! You have been warned.

xwmL0XiT-3jjpbRY7g9yLA.text: This place is great! We needed a late night dinner and the menu was impressive for being 10pm on a weeknight. The food was really good and it wasn't just standard bar food. My buffalo chicken sandwich was huge! A very generous sized chicken breast with lots of fixings. I look forward to coming back the next time I'm in town.

feO1d6is-qNxBPl5gnM6Nw.text: Although I appreciate the new "fresh menu" Dukes is trying to convey I think they missed the mark. I ordered a turkey guacamole sandwich and it came with a choice of sides and I got a salad. The salad came out first which was fine then the sandwich came out and it was just a half a sandwich on a plate. My husband ordered the salmon which was a little salmon strip with mushy broccoli I and rice a roni type rice.  They need tweak the menu more in order for me to go back. The beer wouldn't draw me in. I can go to another sports bar for that.

4gr976FvLxyRX0pfVa5q5Q.text: Great place for sports, shooting pool, playing shuffleboard...you name it!  Just had the chicken Oriental Salad and it was excellent!!

PuSBs9Qf7etb01eQ0HV-Dg.text: I love this place! The new menu is great!! I love how doggy friendly they are :) I read all of bad reviews and i feel like those people are just pretentious! This is a sports bar environment! The servers are always friendly. I actually saw a guy get kind of rude with their server there, and they handled it very professionally (way better than I would have handled it)

rSRDIP_iFhLE71ltcPSOjw.text: Pretty fun place. My wife had been here several times with friends and said we really need to go and since we are in the neighborhood, we did it.  Wings were very good. Expensive but good. The place was huge and extremely loud But what do you expect Cardinals are playing on Sunday afternoon. I would love to go to this place and do some day drinking.  When they say sports bar, they mean it.

9xpTQYnPMVOPccPsZr0Psw.text: We usually go to Dukes for some of their trivia nights. During trivia at least there is usually pretty poor service, we've had it take ages to get drinks, place a food order and eventually get our food. This could just be because they're bust for trivia, but who knows.   The food is typical sports bar food. Nothing special but no issues

1wIU61RBfWEPq9hZcKKzkQ.text: Hole in the wall sports bar with lots of TVs, cheap beer and good food. I got the honey got wings which were big and crispy. My friends got the ribs which are the Thursday special (they have a daily special) and they really enjoyed them.    There are pool tables in the back but there were doing indoor drone races, which was neat.

pqqg4BT8JGjWiz5C1x_5dg.text: Went on a Sunday to watch some football since it has a ton of TVs. Every time the Cardinals score they would give any fan a shot who had Cardinals gear on. This ended up being a lot of shots and definitely some over consumption for some customers. When Cardinals fans became rowdy they didn't blink an eye but if another fan became rowdy they took swift action. I heard them tell non-Cardinal fans that they shouldn't have came to a Cardinals bar when they complained about the aggression of some of the customers. Eventually I was able to meet a very aggressive drunk who was trying to kick some customers out. I was in disbelief but laughed out loud when I realized this drunk was the owner. If you are a Cardinals fan this is a place to get belligerently drunk with the rude staff and drunken owner.

HFdFrkONXmtfbLFmInl4tQ.text: Grabbed a cold beer and a good sandwich on a Thursday night. This place was packed!  I couldn't figure out why so many people talk about this place. Rib night, and good people, make for a good time.  There are plenty of TV's for any angle and draft beer that is ice cold.  Food was good, classic bar and grill food. My sandwich was tasty.  Would go back on another weeknight to hit up happy hour again.

Bfa9X4JKnKSZ0AN9b6xF-w.text: We are new in town and looking to establish our new haunts.  Took us a minute to find this gem, but we love it.  Great bar tenders, Dustin and Miles!  These guys are AWESOME!  SO GLAD WE CAME HERE.  Love the food, love the service and love the conversation!  Thanks!!

5SIO_XnVmfGtqSFE65N1uA.text: This is a nice neighborhood joint with different types of games i.e. darts and pool tables and video. The food is decent with good portions the bill can add up when you get refills on drinks. Overall we had a good experience.
