4cOVjDljPlM5-LOteMq2rA.text: Worst service I've ever experience by the pool tables. Had to go to the bar to get my first beer. Was playing pool and darts obviously spending money. Once I got upset and just came to the bar it was better until the short thicker brunette girl was whispering telling the bar tender it's her table. I would deff consider looking into re hiring some people. Maybe get some people that care, or have bills to pay. The curly haired kid with a shaved sides trash. Tel him to quit flirting and be there for people who wanna spend money and they tried putting extra beers on our tab. Get it together. Felt like I was imposing to spend money there

9-dCZHidbGS_XgHCcKacXQ.text: After spending $400 in this establishment, I was berated by an older gentleman for not being a cardinals fan. When I insisted to the bartenders that he be thrown out for his foul mouth, they informed me he was the owner. I want my money back. Stay away from this disgusting place. Oh, and did I mention they under charged me and I brought it to their attention and this was how I was treated. What a shit hole.

3-dP4jjkk8-RVXuBibW-Xg.text: Sat at the bar thinking service would be better/prompt but it wasn't. It was a Friday night and they weren't that busy. Bartenders weren't as attentive as they could be. Ordered a vodka/cranberry which took a while a water which never came until after my food came which was a simple chicken sandwich and fries that was mediocre.  It may be a local hangout for some, but I wouldn't plan on going back there any time soon.

Z84suGH3N1EXDQsn50VzIg.text: It's a walkable sports bar with food. Been there a few times and generally the eats are underwhelming. The beer might even be watered down. BUT the atmosphere is nice, the service has been very good, and there's stuff to do if you aren't just in the mood to pound beers and watch sports. Love the proximity to home and the disc golf course as well.

hjwA6LBSJ9Q3341AhOhI4g.text: Been here a few times. First time I stopped in it was for karaoke night, had a few drinks, same some karaoke and then rolled. The karaoke system is something I set up in my living room. Nothing spectacular about it, just a bit cheapy. The karaoke host was really entertaining but had troubles controlling a packed Dukes bar.  The second time we went with friends for dinner and drinks. This is when I realized this place has a ton of tvs, and was constantly packed.. Our waited was young he was a tad bit horrible. Forgot food orders, forgot to out in food, misordered food. He did buy is a shot at the end of our night so we let most of it slide, but we were almost to the point of asking for a manager. The food was pretty decent and id say 5/10, I few items came out cold.   Id go back to this place for drinks but id roll somewhere else for chow.

UZC9tHlpSqnurKXydGkTZA.text: We come here almost every Friday with our family. The staff is very friendly and our most favorite waitress is Felicia. She is probably the friendliest waitress I have ever met. I feel like I have known her for years. Duke's always has great food and service. I have never had a bad experience here. It's a nice family environment. It's also a great place if you like to eat clean and healthy they make many accommodations. It's also a kid friendly restaurant and our kids enjoy coming here.

5dN2UyaIgDLbP4I8D734fg.text: I live very close to this sports bar.  I have for years.  Every once in a while I ask myself why I don't go to Dukes more often? Its very close, they have a ton of TVs. They have a decent enough beer selection.  Then I go and I remember why I don't go. Then about 2 years later my memory fades and we go through what happened tonight all over again.   I walk in, take a seat at a high top in the bar area.  3 or 4 waitstaff walks right past and never acknowledges my existence. Tonight I must have been partially stealth like. A woman was walking at the same time I did. I held the door for her. She thanked me. She sat down at a high top in the bar right next to me. She was presented a menu. Ordered a drink, was served her drink and I had yet to be acknowledged.  I waited about 5 more mins and left without a single word uttered.  This is the 2nd time this has happened.    I guess I will try again in 2020.  Maybe my Casper effect will have worn off by then.

pQs4BMk3Wxhm7K7ts2gZUg.text: Let me just start by saying.... I have never in my life experienced a server like Felicia. My girl and i came in after a rough day and felt 2,000x better after we left thanks to the the kind words Felicia had for us. She was so incredibly thoughtful, attentive, kind and gave my friend the best advice to get her through this rough patch. We asked for her schedule so we could come back and see her. Exactly one week later we came in and asked for her section and she greeted us with hugs and noticed how my friend's spirits had lifted since the week before. She's incredibly genuine and we will be back to sit on her section only! Ps get the southwest salad, it is AMAZING ! Thank you Felicia for being the best part of our week every week!  -Drea /Bri

rzYIfkoDCwNQSzdQK5pOJg.text: Came for an afternoon snack and game watching on Sunday Funday.  Michael was behind the bar; friendly and attentive.  TV's all all around perfect for the sports lover.  Had the Southwest Burger delivered timely and delicious.  Summer special on Mondays--$3 burgers!!  I'll definitely be back.

Yla0TX5N1oQap5H-sUTf-Q.text: Went to play disc golf and stopped off for a few drinks first.  They were having a promotional offer for their 20th anniversary where they were offering a free mimosa with every purchase of food. We didn't see this offer, but we ordered food and drinks anyway. We played disc golf then went to leave but saw their sign offering the mimosas. So we went inside and told them we were just here for food but didn't get the mimosa and because the receipt showed we paid the bill after 4pm they wouldn't honor their promotion per Rebecca the manager.  The funny party is, we ordered other drinks again and only asked for one mimosa. Seems to me a $4 mimosa would be worth a few loyal customers.

l1qeOkyt6HAKIKRIh1HV3Q.text: Nasty! Roach came with French dip, friends steak was full of fat and chewy, loud and rude and drunk owner. I recommend anywhere else unless these are things you appreciate!

HAfrRXRh1gdiIeJXYN8cyA.text: A good neighborhood joint. Food is average but priced well with large portions. Staff is always friendly and prompt.

FED8i5Vl7p0lZ5ckANzSbg.text: Ok sports bar on the Greenbelt.Nice patio which is dog friendly.Food is average at best.Drink prices have gone up.Plenty of tvs they will usually put on whatever game you want.Rebecca and Megan are fun bartenders.Daily food specials.Jackie is the day bartender ,nice gal.Her father Al is the owner who occasionally gets drunk and loves to talk politics,which is not a good idea for a bar owner he is a hardcore Democrat yet most of the clientele are more conservative.A lot of couples go here. Pool tables and shuffle board.

RY6GMdbeffemRGkHUMEL_A.text: This is an update to my previous review, we came here yesterday for NFL Week 1 and we enjoyed ourselves very very much. Got to the bar at 9:30am, walked up to the door and they had a tv map already done outside so you know exactly where your game was being showed, we were there for Lions/Vikings and they had it on in the lounge with sound.   Got in early enough to grab a seat on the couch that made our experenice that much better. Our server(s) were as prompt as they could be seeing it was very busy.   The crowd was upbeat and fun and the atomsphere was great.  We will be back for Weeks 3-17, since I'll be at the game next Sunday here.  Go Lions!!!

-sD8hqtzR0ZzUwRqNpvzuA.text: Great drinks. Terrible food. About what you expect in a sports bar. It's got a nice view being on the green belt.

QjMBGifrPV_v6X0t4uQdCA.text: service is hit or miss but amazing sports bar.  No DUI taxi and the owner is big cards fan.

yVp5hQyGLyr6vuApPTCi5Q.text: A good dive bar in Scottsdale if you want to stay away from the main downtown area. Tons of Tv's which are viewable from nearly any angle you sit in the restaurant including a large TV with the main game on. Even though it was packed when we were there, staff was still friendly and fairly attentive given the crowd. Food was actually good and the beer was about average price of any place else in town.   I will most likely be back to this bar for more games in the future.

VvPuJy0zld0jDMfcTnXkOQ.text: We decided to try a new place and what a mistake! The only good thing I can say about this place was out waitress Brie. She did everything she could to give us good service but that's about where it ended. It's a Friday night and they are busy but first thing the guys tried to order bud light draft and they don't have any then they don't have bud draft .  The guys finally decided on a different beer and they stirred the best with a straw to make it look fresher. As we are placing our order we are warned they are busy and it will be about 30 minutes to get food. We decided to stay instead of starting over somewhere else.  30 minutes later my husband and I get our food, 15 minutes later 2 of our friends get their food then another 15 minutes or other friends for their food. One of my friends fries were ice cold another ones order was completely wrong. The other 2 said their food wasn't  worth the wait. We complained to a bartender and they chewed out waitress out and none of it was her fault. They had our waitress in tears. While waiting we also saw 4 servers did in the trash for something and go straight to getting people's food without even washing their hands. Finally we had to be THOSE people and get a manger and they discounted or meals but that was not the point. They need better people in the kitchen better hygiene and better stocking of popular beer.

hdULjVxUBXnMnL2zQq2OnA.text: I feel like such an idiot - we tried this place when we first moved here, walked in, then walked right out. 7 months later, we say "hey, let's try this place Dukes ! Never been there "  I groaned to my self when we walked in "you IDIOT". This place still sucks.   OK , we wanted to see game 3 of the Heat-Thunder finals, and guess what the audio was in the bar ? A frikking GOLF tournament ! Can you say LAME ?   So we walked in and politely asked these 2 scummy 20-somethings if someone was sitting on the table between them and the big screen showing the bball game (which also overlooked the temporary kiddie play area with about 8  6 year olds having a birthday party - egad)   One of them said "yea, they're free, if you don't block my view". I glared at him with my best  "as if..." look (he was puny). So we sat down, I looked at the kids, then my wife, and we both said 'let's go back to Majerles", so we left.   I just don't like the layout of the place, it's got awkward and uncomfortable seating, and the absolutely worst thing about this dump ?   Kids-in-the-bar. Yes, there are kids in the big section off to the right.  I don't go to a bar that allows kids (Zipps in N. Scottsdale does and they're off my list, too)  Anyway, there are TONS of better bars around town and I dunno, the place just gives me the hibbidy-jibbidys for some reason...

VDs85eJkHumBkGO_nNS0nw.text: I have been going to duke's with friends for years...past 3 times there not so good twice are food was frozen they would not take it off Bill just bought a drink which was nice but should have been addressed...also sitting at bar last time was like we weren't even there...very disappointing we really like going there

zNUOQAbpzQ3-sxs3tQgl2w.text: We used to love going to Dukes on Wednesdays for trivia.  Then they changed their menu, increased their prices, and didn't change the level of service.  I've never been treated so rudely as I was tonight.  I will not be returning to Dukes.

9XiOtAy_6WfEe9EqyJidwg.text: Headed to Dukes to watch the Montana football game as they have a satellite they show the game with. The past few years we have been fortunate enough to see the game at home on Root Sports or Altitude.  This is one of the weeks the game was on neither. So off to Dukes we trekked from Glendale. First of all when the game is on at noon you should not be waiting till noon to find your satellite feed. As  we have gone  sporadically in the past 5 years this has become the norm. Wait till noon to find the game. Spend the entire 1st quarter trying to find the game. Someone finally hooks their computer up and we see 30 seconds of game and 10 minutes of buffering.  Don't plan on watching the game if you are expecting to. The owner should be offering a discount to all who sat there that ordered food and drinks. Not my idea of watching a game at a sports bar. I will say the food and drinks were great as usual.  Believe me I have eaten there more than once without being able to see the game. I also see you have removed all the booths and put in foosball tables leaving  even less seating. Might I suggest moving your pool tables into that same room and putting all those tables into the middle room which is much lighter and would provide more seating . Also you might want to think about upgrading your satellite if you are going to consider yourself a site for Montana football.

q8eyi_BuTwaUcj0tjau9Og.text: Is this place closed?  Just went at 3:30 PM on Monday and the doors were locked and nobody was inside.

W2JBcONL0jHaiNBoQ29itg.text: If you're going for trivia night go early to grab a table and food. The orders run about 45min behind once trivia is about to start. It gets packed. I've only been here in trivia nights and enjoy the atmosphere. The hamburgers and appetizers are well seasoned and in large serving sizes. The alcoholic drinks are hit or miss. Tequila sunrises, whiskey sours, and Jack and cokes were too strong or just not made well. The waitress was nice enough to take a couple drinks our tap because of the taste. I'd go back.

wRvHxl9iffRClJ8A92DVJQ.text: Great spot, friendly staff, good food and drinks with a ton of TVs, pool tables, darts, fooze, buck hunter etc.  Reasonable prices and open floor plan.  Great friendly atmosphere and like the other reviews report its not a "Scottsdale scene", this is where you and your friends go for a beer, to watch a game, shoot some pool (or fireball shots..maybe both), or stop in midway through a disc golf game.  Patio is dog friendly so weekends its a great place to walk and enjoy a beer with other dog lovers.  This is a great spot for a casual night with friends, trivia on wed and Fridays is better then most places trivia (actually challenging general knowledge not just filled with crap pop culture questions, its actually good for all ages). One of the few True sports bars on the east side of town.  The owner AL is there most times and takes great pride in his bar and sponsors allot of local teams and charity events!    Food Review (Updated 1/22/16): Well when I had written the original review they had just redone the whole menu and everything was fresh way above expectations for a while.  Although I still go there all the time and love this place I felt I need to update the food part as it was not accurate any more.  The food is still way better but has slipped back to above average bar food, and in the Scottsdale market with gastro pubs and sports bars everywhere if your just going for a great food experience there are allot of choices specialize in food. If you want a great neighborhood sports bar with good food and tons of TVs this is your place.  Quesadilla, Egg McDuke Burger, Chicken Tenders, are still my favorites.  FAMILY?: During normal lunch and dinner hours it is fine for a family but if you take your kids to watch a football game at a bar on Sundays maybe you should read some more parenting books and not be mad that its a BAR environment (a few of other reviews complain about not kid friendly during football, personally i hope they don't come back as they really mess up my football experience giving me dirty looks when I curse the Damn Packers... its a sports bar people).       FOOTBALL:  DA BEARS!!!! Unlike zips and other venues in Scottsdale you can actually watch all the games at once there is a wall of tvs not just scattered tvs.  Get there at least 30 min before your game on Sundays as it fills up and you need to snag a table or grab one from people leaving from prior game.  It is a go to football spot for most people in a 5 mile radius.

VQB7mVSUxS3pq3s_eB6WaA.text: The owner is (for lack of a better phrase), a business-incompetent jerk.  I will NEVER return to Duke's. There are amazing restaurant choices nearby that I highly suggest everyone support.  Bad business should not be encouraged.

q9uDGBtihKPk2oIHVle25Q.text: My friend just moved in to the apartments next door and got a $25 gift card so we decided to check it out. I was more than pleased with the atmosphere and friendly staff. The food is delicious and very reasonably priced. Wednesday and Friday are trivia nights and I will definitely be returning to enjoy!

wZ3qS6gEwh1UZJAx2uTO-Q.text: This is the place to be. Football, pool, trivia or a bite to eat. Their soups are awesome and Ribs Ribs Ribs Thursdays are the best. The waitstaff are friendly and The TVs always have every sporting event on. Ask for meg

ZCDUOmc-gpwyywrt6y_PQg.text: Place has really gone down hill,  is it pretty much a dive bar now w/ prices to match the Scottsdale club scene w/ service nearly nonexistent, do yourself a favor stay far away from this s*!t hole

iV6-8d_KVIc7G-ilf3z49Q.text: Location always plays a role in how a place is perceived, but I think that's particularly True for Dukes. This is about the closest bar to my parents house in south Scottsdale, so I've started coming here more and more when I come to visit. It's located in a random strip mall in a fairly residential area so it's not a place that people are gonna necessarily seek out. That being said, I think if Dukes were located someplace differently (even if it were still in a strip mall) it might be thought of a LITTLE more highly.  I mean, it's big. There's a TON of TV's (they even have them in the bathrooms). The drinks are cheap (especially the happy hour specials, which I believe actually run pretty late). The have pool tables, darts, and I think even a few arcade games. There's a patio. In my experiences, it's clean for the most part. They have a LARGE food menu. To be honest, I've only tasted things here and there when others have ordered stuff, and although it's not great, it's not bad, and like the drinks the food is affordable (I believe they offer a different deal each day). They also offer some sort free car service for those who can't drive home (I believe within 5 miles). The friend I usually come here with lives within walking distance, but we've taken advantage of it before. And like I said, the strip mall where's Dukes is located is in a highly residential area so I'm sure there's a lot of people who can take advantage of this service.  The only complaint I have about Dukes is I have encountered more than one bitchy/slow server. I've never been here when it's that crowded though, so it's generally not been a big deal (might be a different story when this place is packed).

Jw3nIicXlPLcKUUrrfpOWQ.text: Good deals on certain days for food. Large selection of sports to watch on the various tvs. The patio setup is great in the fall/winter but brutal during the summer months. The service staff is attentive and take orders as soon as you sit, but I wish the menu had more variety.

v34bw_mcJ_O5CLZmPlAKjQ.text: Dukes more like Pukes.  Positives- AVG food and Descent service Negatives- This place is dirty the chairs were dirty and the glasses and cups were old and dingy. My friend was given and Ice holder that keeps the beer in the pitcher cold and it was broken and looked old and NASTY. Also a weird crowd with very little scenery, if ya know what I mean. Won't be back!

JYMKVSu4flLb8ZhIQmZPrw.text: Great atmosphere, but!! It took an hour and 45 min to get our food. The one star is for the amazing service our waitress gave us. I felt bad for her that the kitchen was so slow!! Thanks Megan.

63iCqLxvi9c_gPgtgZuQAQ.text: I have to review Dukes because I live right next to it.  Even though it's a sports bar that looks like it fell right out of the early 90's, it's still a good place.  All the food is good bar food that's not expensive.  Great beer specials nightly and a hilarious crowd of people.  Go in and grab a seat at the bar, you'll see old drunkards, young idiot frat kids......I guess that's pretty much it, but it's still fun.  Go on Thursday for Karaoke, there are these two creepy old guys that sit seperately from one another, and just pass off the mic each song between the two of them.  It is the most awkwardly entertaining thing you will ever see.  Also, Saturday and Sunday morning bloody mary bar that you can't beat.

0EAH6T1c2c1h08GFXlES-w.text: As a sports bar with a SB menu it a good set up if you like this kind of fare. Unfortunately they only serve conventional brand beers instead of local and or regional mircro beers. So if you like the corporate brand beer and basic sports bar food you'll be fine. Staff is cool and they offer a ride home service if you need it.  The owner "Duke" pops in for a few and will talk to customers.  I stopped in only because it was in walking distance from 3 palms hotel i was staying at.

cPqi61AXzI8KPuVo22cFPw.text: Great service! Fish tacos are fantastic.  My son had wings and loved them.  Great bloody marys, nice portions, not too big or too small.  Very reasonably priced.  Near the green belt so eat, drink, walk..;)

43lNb-dyroykXm9E99Bxgg.text: The food is better than typical bar fare - my husband and I both enjoyed the food - but I cannot recommend this place because we had such a bad experience here.   This was our first visit to Duke's on McDowell Road, which is pretty close to our home. Great location for a sports bar and a cool place to watch sports on a hot summer day in Scottsdale.   We went to Duke's to watch Game 7 of the NHL Western Conference playoffs, and the owner refused to put it on in the main part of the bar, despite multiple customers' requests.  He told hockey fans to go to the pool (billiards) room to watch the game. No one went.  As we were leaving, my husband told the owner that we would have stayed longer if we could have heard the game. "What do you want to hear, the puck going into the net?" he says, laughing at us. And he tells us, "See ya later," telling us if we don't like it we can leave. Who does that??  We weren't asking him to turn off the Dodgers game. We wanted him to turn off the sound for baseball and turn ON the sound for hockey.    We'll never go back to Duke's. Scottsdale has many other, better choices.

t7DdO9DSvr4ENIe3pjk2lw.text: Great venue for a low-key, sports environment. They offer lots of beer on draft as well as bottled choices.  Try their potato skins w/fat kid's ketchup (i.e Ranch) - you won't be disappointed. Made me a tad bloated the next day, but still tasty and sinful.  Service was excellent - very friendly servers w/frequent check-ins.

AXeiJLT1FpKiQYUr_O6ztQ.text: The worst!! It took the waitress nearly half an hour to bring us our drinks, and nearly an hour and a half to get our food (and our appetizer came out with the main course). When we finally did get our food, it was cold, and the bread on my sandwich had hardened - it actually cut my mouth it was so stale! Our waitress ignored us so effectively that we had to find a different server to help us replace the dish so I could actually eat. I cut this place a little slack because it was trivia night, and thus very busy, but still. Bad service is bad service. At least the trivia was fun.

TbWSzzQy_nKID6MZebPBOg.text: Pretty cool sports bar in Scottsdale! We play softball at Papago so this is the perfect spot afterwards for some apps & drinks. The menu was a little expensive for what I'm used to at a sports bar ($11 for wings...). We got the sliders (3 for $6) & tots (1/2 order for $4) & 2 beers ($5 ea). It was pretty popping on a Wed around 9 pm-- I think Trivia was going on. Service was good, we will be back!

SNtGE22U2Uq0umCDw6UIIg.text: I absolutely love this bar! Here once a week if not more. My parents love when they visit from Cali and come on trivia nights. My pup loves the patio as well.

5RIMUYFFExBJzhDLw1k15A.text: If you're looking for a dive bar that just oozes sports...this is the place to be! Now, Dukes is a great place to settle in for a Cardinals game because they an official Cardinals headquarters. Not to mention you get a free shot after a Cardinals touchdown if you are wearing gear with the logo on it!   They are also an ASU bar, but let's not get into that. You won't find me there for those games....beardown! They have so many TV's of all shapes and sizes around the bar so I'm sure you'll find a game or sport that you enjoy. Not to mention its a big place with multiple sitting areas, indoor and outdoor...and yes they have a couple tv's outside!  I haven't tried many things on their menu yet but I am a huge fan of their Honey Hot wings. They are delicious!! Last night I tried their Wednesday ribs special and the barbeque sauce is so yummy. Next time I'm ordering their chicken tenders buffalo style! On Sunday's they have a build-your-own Bloody Mary bar that goes till 4pm.   Last night I was also able to experience my very first Trivia Night! It was a lot of fun and the rules are pretty straight forward and simple, however, the questions are not as the night goes on! It was nice to get out on a week night to try something different. I think they have Trivia Night twice a week.   The staff is friendly, our server last night was awesome. It's a sport's bar, with bar food, and sport's bar decor, nothing fancy, nothing special, but it is a welcoming, have a good time kinda place.

wPikeVJMQL2G3CgE1qg5Ig.text: Our neighbors told us about the prime rib at dukes, we went last week, our first and last time, not cooked there the bartender told us, so you can only have maybe Med, we like ours rare, I would just go and pick up from AJs!

hn2RO1Dm_qPRA4lnA2FdrQ.text: Great food and excellent service.  We had the club sandwich and irish nachos ... so good!

x48V2XQ8ha0UoXzdpKjnIA.text: The service is hit or miss. Just like the food. 8 out of 10 times the burgers are excellent but then they lack consistency. A few times they've screwed up the order and sometimes it's overcooked. They could offer onion rings as a side with burgers instead of a $10 appetizer. That would be nice. When it's busy this place seems to fall apart badly. They really have some servers who try and do their best but you can tell management and leadership is lacking. The owner is often here drinking but I've yet to see him lift a finger to help service expediting food or getting drinks for people when the bar and wait staff is clearly buried.

fepdxPVYYVN37N81j_NTyQ.text: Very welcoming staff! Great tap list and inviting environment. Had the Hess ipa solid local beer. The fish and chips were great highly recommended. Rebecca and Jackie were the best! I can't wait to come back.

Xpqu7zVM4LrhL1CueQl_fQ.text: Hello my fellow yelpers, please take the time to read this yelp because I'm going to expose the truth about the establishment..  I used to be a employee here at this establishment and I regret it. The food was terrible, the staff was rude and disrespectful(except a few) and the owner.. Don't get me started on how much of an a hole he was.   Now I'll start with the food, working at this establishment, the food took forever to cook.. I would ring in a simple salad and not get it for 20-30 mins.. Now it doesn't take that long to make a salad, the coordination and the communication was terrible.. As a server we would always have a pager on us when the food was done, and there were time food would sit in the window for a long period of time.. Because the cooks wouldn't page us.. Now that being said.. I would ask the cooks to remake my food.. But I guess reheating it in the microwave counts as a "remake". Now Dukes signature dish I would say would have to be the wings.. Now, I've eaten alot of chicken wings and this place they're disgusting.. All they do is deep fry them and then extremely sauce them and give them to the customer.. You can say it was more sauce than wings.. Which would incline to a terrible stomach ache the next day.. Another this is alot of the apps were already pre-made.. Other than the mozzarella sticks, everything else was store bought.. The hummus, the cheese, onions rings.. Everything. Do don't be fooled when they say it's all homemade.. Pfft yea, and pigs fly. Also don't go on a busy day either and order food because as I said ealier, you'll wait up to an hour just for your appetizer..  Now for the staff,  Let's start with the bartenders..   MEGAN- very welcoming, very nice and has a great personality.. If it wasn't for her I would of never stayed because she had a heart and that's what defines her.   MONICA- She was ok, I would ask her something and she would give me a straight answer.. Now when I requested a drink from her.. Yea it took awhile to get my drinks..but she's eh ok.   Monique- was there to work and Always gossip about everyone . I hated that about her.. She was always gossiping like a 12 year girl alway talking about someone If it was either a customer or even An employee..like it was some kind of reality TV show. I always came into work thinking it was high school again because I felt bullied.   Mark- oh mark.. This man was in a "management" position and was terrible at it.. He would always flirt with the girls, giving them free shots and would rather Stare at a pair of boobs than help his fellow Co workers out.. He was always an a hole to the other workers (other than the girls). As an example, I would ask him for a drink.. His response..no. Or yea hold on.. Then he'll "playfully" laugh and say, just kidding.. Like no you weren't.. I heard him talk rude to customers, I heard him make comments that were disrespectful.  So if you go to Dukes and see mark working.. I advise.. LEAVE! just turn around and leave   Now finally Rebecca (crow) she's like Megan, she was nice and very informative.. She always had answer to my questions..so I don't have any thing to say about her..   Now finally the wait staff.   Just a heads up, you walk in there, the majority of the waitstaff are either high, or extremly rude.. There are a couple female staff are just there to work.. Rude to thier tables and rude to their fellow employees.. Like honestly if you see an ad for this place.. DO NOT APPLY!!!!! Unless your a total B*tch or a stoner.. Because that's all what Al seems to hire.  Now to the owner- AL. Word of advice.. DO NOT GO TO THIS BAR WHEN THIS MAN IS THERE!!!! And you'll know it's him because he's either yelling at someone or the only drunk ass old man there at the bar. This man has terrible.. Terrible.. Terrible managing experience.. You get hired the first thing he says is.. Your my family and I treat you like family.. HA LIES. I've seen this man grabbed and PULLED one of the servers hand and yell at her because there was a napkin on the floor.. This man only has three computer systems and  he's yelled at people for not using the one in the area. He's yelled at people for not having drinks on the table when they just sat down..hes very judgemental...towards other people.. You walk into the bar wearing cowboy stuff prepared to be yelled At to leave.. Or even shoved out. Because this man will lay his hands on you, if he doesn't like you, he's even layed his hands on the waitstaff thinking it's ok to shove your finger into someone chest or to grab some girls arm and pull her away to yell at her because there is a napkin on the floor.. One of these days he's going to do that to the wrong person and he's going to lose that bar..

78o1Admco17SDAzKTMiTSw.text: Awesome meal. The Tuna Steak Caesar salad hit the spot. A late night snack put a smile on this face. Great tunes, and a nice outdoor patio ... Non smoking makes it nicer , Megan made sure everyone was filled and satisfied with what they want.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great late night snack

smCKruU218-Sl9qhL0H2Pg.text: This place is the worst. The food is terrible. I mean, really, really, bad. The majority if the servers have zero personality.  The drink specials are good and they dislike Cowboys (the football team), so thats a plus.

vVm9ab4iwiRjayp1xCvZlQ.text: STAY AWAY!  Old crowd and ragging old drunkin' Owner!!  Go to Papago Brewery instead.   DO NOT SUPPORT BAD BUSINESSES !  Review Below:  Ive been to this bar a few times, every time I leave annoyed.  The bar is in a great location, and they have a dog friendly patio - last night I found out why it's so terrible.  While getting a drink my dog kindly walked over to the owner, he then began shouting at me and my dog.  He drunkenly ranted about how the dog 'looked' like it might take a poop, I asked if he hates dogs so much and looses his ability to control his voice to a paying customer, why he would even say dog are allowed.    This place finally makes sense; it's the worst bar around because the owner is an old angry drunkin' man.  I actually feel sorry for his wife, as she stood there in all of the glory that was his anger, ragging at an upstanding military veteran and paying customer, in what must be a failing bar.

sTdHqc69t8Z4rGkCrvBeOA.text: Has a patio and dogs are welcomed. Inside the bar, many tv's are mounted and positioned well to enjoy games. food was tasty. service was at best mediocre. we were there two hours and our waiter failed to refill my water until he brought me the bill. It was an acceptable place to watch a game in a pinch, but not likely to return.

W_faFt7VZPkb7s7wSh510g.text: Dukes is a solid sports bar with a low key vibe and friendly staff. My only complaint is as a DD; they not only charge $4 for a soda but $1 a refill. Most bars don't charge for soda, especially for DDs.

QiCYbgtzYg5TFAcw6Slmig.text: I like going to dukes! I think it's a really fun environment and has good bloody Mary's which are hard to find in Phoenix.  I've been there maybe 10 times and only once did we get decent service. If it's busy when you get there, expect to ask for your server, as they won't notice you for 30 minutes or more. Once, we had a group of 6, and the waitress finally came by and brought us fries. When we had eaten half the fries and she returned, she said "who ordered these?" We had all assumed one of us did or she brought them over as an apology for the wait. Wrong! She grabbed them and scolded us for eating another table's fries. The one time we received our food within a normal time frame and had a polite server, made a world of a difference. This won't prevent me from returning for a game and a bloody, but Id go there more if the service improved.

Q4GQ67MBCQ-ftdDbr5T9AQ.text: The wait staff is amazing and the food is good, but God forbid you're in here when the owner is getting drunk. He runs people out  a lot if they get in disagreements...

B65ZzfsfzyfkPLKoSUCA3g.text: We were riding the Scottsdale trail with our granddaughter and stopped at our half way point to eat lunch. It has now been an hour and we are still waiting for our food. I understand that the Montana Football game is their busiest day, but seriously. Plan ahead and work at full staff. This bar is huge inside and I'm sure it's packed. We opted to eat in the patio and every table is full. Good thing we packed some string cheese. Very disappointed in the service. We were here 2 weeks ago on Sunday after riding and really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. May rethink this spot. Portillos sounds really good right now!!

tRRR11zBvrZs_DJ1nU3TGg.text: This place actually has great potential to live up to its self-proclaimed title of "Scottsdale's best bar'.  The biggest thing holding it back is the tyrannical ownership of Al McCarthy. With the same unapologetic arrogance of a drunk Donald Trump, he rules with an inebriated iron first, consistently using his bar to get loudly and aggressively drunk and assert his "power" over everyone around him. He has even been seen inciting violence on a plethora of occasions. Nobody's safe, people who have been loyal to the place for years will get screamed at and even barred from returning, just for being unlucky enough to be caught in alcoholic owners path at the wrong time.  He then proceeds to drive home every day in spite of his intoxication. A deceitful sign that Al displays in front of the bar is an 'A' food safety rating.  Hard to believe a food safety inspector could miss all the cockroaches in the kitchen, keep an eye out there's plenty that often roam there way out to the the bar as well.  Over a decade of corruption is the only explanation for this display of dishonesty. Just about everything else about the place is good, one star for Al and his refusal to allow his bar to be brought into the 21st century.

N_BvZ4_fMhV1SiJRqxzFEw.text: We have seen our server walk back and forth and never talk to us. Just wanted a beer and some food but that's to much to ask. This place is AWFUL

wCvS-VXhOg5S6YuCl8Fy_w.text: It's a great local spot, and is exactly what you expect of it. It has a ton of TVs, good bar food, and great prices. I suggest this for a laid back night, or to watch a game. They'll accommodate most requests on one of their many TVs.

-Hqsgcc-rd8sVkG2mGsU3A.text: Oh good ole Dukes.  This place is what it is... A sports bar with no frills or fluff and I like it.  Tons of TVs to watch sports and if you get bored you can play pool, darts, arcade, and even buck hunter (my fave)! The food is nothing to rave about but not bad at all. We always order the wings, fish and chips, quesadilla, and of course tater totts.  Don't come here and expect the scene you'll get from old town. This place is for locals and friends... The more the merrier in a casual environment.   Ps: they have trivia night and I've done it a few times and had a blast!

ZCjbGzmqEO9ZQL9Z4rPCLw.text: Great local sports bar! The bartenders, specifically Monica, Rebecca and Mark are super friendly and provided great service. All and all an awesome watering hole.

0iaYTWFLjQhcxmXvTrJ4iA.text: Went to Duke's again the other night and realized I had never written them up. We go there often enough. For no other reason than there is always a space at the bar and thir wings are respectable. In my many visits (happy hour pitchers are a GREAT deal), we have tried many of the sandwiches, burgers, even fish and chips. Nothing super good or super bad. Standard bar fare. Lots of ASU students working there, lots of sports on the plethora of televisions. Can get really crazy during big games. Trivia Sat nights 8 pm. Also fun. Dog friendly patio and frisbee golf right outside. What more can you ask? Also fun is watching Duke's owner (I think his name is AL) command staff to keep the place to his standards.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sports
Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar room
Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar n TVs

aLqbRBZ4GcT5D1demRE9Qg.text: Shuffleboard, pool, golf arcade game, foosball and dartboards make for a fun time at this place. They also have a HUGE interior bar with plenty of space for seating. We typically go during the day so it's slow. We've gone a few times at night and there was live music playing, which is awesome. Wednesday nights they do live trivia at 7:30pm and Karaoke on Thursday and Saturday nights.   If you aren't interested in singing or competing in anything.... theres a bunch of TVs so it's cool to go to watch sports games. They have really affordable food and specials everyday.  Here's the breakdown: MONDAY: is a burger, turkey burger or pork sandwich for 3.50 (+1.00 for fries) TUESDAY: is prime rib with salad and fries for 10.75 WEDNESDAY: is ribs served with coleslaw, fries or potato salad for 9.75. Or their healthier option of one of their salads they offer for 8.50 THURSDAY: is the same rib offer from Wednesday. FRIDAY: is the shrimp platter with fries and coleslaw for 8.95 Or Baja fish tacos for 8.95 that come with fries. SATURDAY: Jack Daniels marinated steak! With salad and baked potatoes for 10.75  Another great thing about this place is how accommodating they are if you have a large party, you can bring 50+ people without having to pay reservation fees and all that nonsense like a lot of restaurants/bars will do you in the scottsdale.   Also, I've never had to use it... since I live 10 minutes away walking distance, but they do free "avoid a DUI" drives home from here...thats super legit.   I will forever love this place!

znsSMbzvgyWWkKuGx2gUuA.text: Hand cut fries are NOT hand cut. Frozen fries just thrown in grease. The Bloody Mary bar was a stingy mess. The old lady behind the bar didn't take our order right away. We wanted breakfast, she said we couldn't order breakfast because it was after 11:00, it was 11:01. About 2 minuets later they rang the bell to indicate breakfast was over.

eLhczPCjiuw7kzn5O9Qakg.text: I stopped in here to grab a quick bite before my pedicure appointment close by.  I found a nice spot at the bar, and was immediately greeted by the bar tender and brought a cold glass of ice water.    I reviewed the menu, and then ordered a small Cobb Salad, with medium rare Steak on it.  Whey my salad came out, it was larger than I expected, and delicious.  The steak portion was generous, and it was delicious and perfectly cooked.  All of the ingredients were fresh, and when I realized that the kitchen had left off the boiled egg, the bar tender quickly ran back to the kitchen and brought me the missing egg.  It was a very comfortable experience, and I intend to go back to enjoy that salad again sometime soon.

iX4HwL0Vgtoqh6_QHpOENA.text: Ended up here on a Saturday night after a long day of solid drinking... and it continued nicely here with some karaoke.  I can't speak to the food here because we didn't order any, but the service was solid and the drinks were nice & cold.    The karaoke host was great and the selection of songs was vast.  I like that they had a couple of books to look at and choose your songs from - sadly the last few times I went it was just luck of the draw whether they had the song you wanted to sing.  I'll be back, and next time I'll try the food!!

uoDa2NLcE9NGgovz-4rDTQ.text: The night started at Dukes. It was bigger and cleaner than it looks from the outside and offers an impressive range of salad. Yes, I had salad at a dive bar and I do not regret it. I also had beer, and a vodka cran on the house for whatever reason. I must say that I like Dukes. Ok, it will not become my go-to but if I lived close enough, I would be a regular of sorts.   Small stuff that I really enjoy, is the fact that you can borrow a phone charger (you have to give up credit card for trade) and have it charge your phone while you do whatever you do. Small stuff that I find very cool.  Also they have this cool anti-drink&drive policy where they take you home if you are inebriated. I don;t know the details, but the fact that there is one is very cool. Very very cool   In the end, it's a like a divey sports bar. And that is OK.

qy-KgjHCUSHX57HhC11d4Q.text: Down in Scottsdale on business, this was the after meeting place.  Great ribs, shrimp, salmon, and sliders.  If the carried Bud light on tap, I would give them 6 stars.

-HlBT5r2N02AGfzib_B5eg.text: Duke Duke Duke  Duke of Fail Duke Duke Duke of Fail  I would say this place was my type of bar 10 years ago, but now in my early 30's I need something more up to date.  This place is huge and has a decent patio.  Table to video games in every room.  Nostalgic sports awards to basic sport memorabilia hangs along the ways with advertisement of alcohol.  Large TV screens here and there with random channels playing.    I just didn't get a good feel about this place.  Drinks seem pretty affordable here, but the food wasn't too impressive.  We ordered the burger with fries, artichoke dips and jalapeno poppers.  I didn't eat the burger, but the fries were stale.  Ever ate fries that were in the freezer too long and the left in frying oil that needed to be changed?  Yeah it tasted like that.  The artichoke dips seemed like it came out of a box.  It didn't have much taste and the only thing I ate was the tortilla chips.  Finally the poppers were probably the "best" of the night between the dishes.  Nice and creamy once you bit into it and crispy on the outside.    Overall, serve was good since we were the only large group of people in there.  If you live close by and need a drink I would recommend this place.  However, the immature crowd and poor karaoke music doesn't make we want to stay too long. - Enjoy!

7ek66VIzVnam3yHPwN_qxg.text: For a sports bar this one is one of the most underrated but most awesome places in Scottsdale.  Big game days can make it get packed so arrive early if you want a seat.  There are plenty of TVs through the bar so being able to see a game is always possible.   They have the main bar area, a dining area, 2 large group rooms which can be reserved for parties and work functions.  There are areas for pool, darts, and other fun games. They offer karaoke nights and team trivia nights.  They also have ample patio seating with both a smoking and nonsmoking sides. The patio overlooks part of the green belt and the Shelby disc golf course.  Dogs are welcome on the patio too.   The food isn't fine dinning quality but it is one of the best bar foods I've had (and I grew up touring sports bar with my pops so I have tried many)  They have a fabulous burger called the egg McDuke in once a fried egg is topping off your burger.  Probably my favorite dish.  Most of their appetizers and salads are phenomenal.   I am never disappointed by their drinks. The beer specials are always great tasting. Their shots are ridiculous in size and always potent.  The best feature about Dukes is their no DUI service.  This is a free cadillac chauffeured ride home so that you don't have to drive drunk. More places should offer such a service.

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg McDuke burger.

IFKgZqnXknfij77njMGv5Q.text: We stopped in this morning.  The door was open, but the waitress finally came over and said, "we don't actually open for 30 min" (hmm, so maybe keep the door locked?).  We live in the area and this was our second time at Duke's.  Our first time the food was ok, but the customer service is really lacking!

O5XUIo1Vaqyi3Gv6n8svog.text: Server was awful. I asked for wine and the server said they didn't have any . I looked at the table across and two people had wine. He didn't know the beers- we knew more than him. He took our order and brought out our food, but left without leaving us silverware or condiments. My salad was watery and tasted terrible . We had to ask other servers for things we needed. The waiter also took my drink before I was finished . Overall horrible, horrible service .

Owmku2lFEMhK-yPJxUVHiQ.text: I just moved to Scottsdale, and Dukes is right down the road from where I live. I went twice when I first got here. The first time I went to watch the Panthers game.. since there are no Carolina bars in PHX. Our waitress was AMAZING! She was friendly and down to earth, and always went out of the way to make sure we were satisfied. The food during that visit was pretty sub-par- I got their strawberry walnut salad, and they offered me every kind of dressing ever except Balsamic Vinaigrette. I feel like that's a pretty basic dressing to have and I'm still confused as to why they have 3 fruit vinaigrettes but no balsamic- but I digress. My boyfriend got a burger medium-rare, and it came out well done. I will say, though, we ordered onion rings as an appetizer and they were SO DELICIOUS. I don't know what kind of crack they put in their breading but omg gimme dat!  The onion rings were actually what coerced me to go back a few days later- I couldn't stop thinking about them! This time I went with the BBQ chicken salad and it was better. On this visit, we met the  owners and they were both really great- we could tell that they truly cared about their business and their patrons. Definitely a plus.  My only other complaint about this bar is the lack of lighting. They have closed shutters over all of their windows. Yes, I understand this is the desert and it gets hot- but it would be nice to not feel so cramped in.

fV3PvZj3o5p5MAdZPXb30g.text: Atmosphere was great for watching football,  service was good and a Bloody Mary bar was a treat.  We had a group of 8 and a nice table to converse.  My beef is with NOT informing us that the 18% gratuity was included.......therefore I tipped another 20%......sb the responsibility of the staff to remind us.....shame on you!!!   I won't be back!

9ynsZO2sOH9_f29YN2jYRQ.text: Great neighborhood sports bar. Wonderful staff and decent food. My faves are chicken cordon blue sandwich and western burger. Good soups and nice salad selection. Avoid the onion soup - no onions and cold cheese on top.  Overall though a great place and nice food!

photos.caption: Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Giant Duke&#39;s billboard in Mexico on the way back to the USA.
Photo of Duke's Sports Bar and Grill - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lady Liberty welcoming everyone to Dukes.

76I2EtHFhKcCAaL0yruTjg.text: I love Duke's! One of the best neighborhood bars I've ever been too. Great bar food and good wait staff keeps me coming back. In addition to the karaoke and bingo on Thursdays!

Qf-6imyajIKqZM3Etk7R9A.text: Duke's is my place to grab some lunch when I want to get away from the same old grind of a sandwich. The food is okay and has always been fresh when I have eaten here with co-workers. The hot wings, burgers, sandwiches, and salads are all pretty good!  It is a sports bar so if you are wanting to do an intimate lunch or want to speak without having to raise your voice a bit. This would not be the place for you. If you are a sports junkie than this is the perfect place for you to come and relax and watch various sports on there 15+ televisions and have a cold beer.

7zXxhzTsWHHdzuFuJoa0Rw.text: I come here every time I visit Scottsdale.  It is in my old neighborhood so it's a nice place to reminisce.  They have an outdoor patio that overlooks Eldorado Park.  They have pool tables.  The service is always pretty good and the food is yummy.  Good prices, good times:)

Lh1sAjHAGXDdpnYdYSHUYA.text: They make an awesome prime rib steak salad for 8.75, I love there tuesday special, prime rib steak with fries and salad for like 7 dollar, but you have to order a drink to get the special, so i order a bottle water, still a great deal. The steak is very tender and Duke's only use the best meat, plus they only use non transfat oil to cook all there food. Duke's kind of health councious on how they cook things. But eating a burger is still bad for you, but at less they are trying to keep it more natural.

j2O77TYM7Jn9_04mrETmnQ.text: Good service.  Food is ok, but a little expensive.  Lots of tvs.  Friendly atmosphere with all ages present.  Pretty loud.  Got the chili - it is good but they put way too much cheese in it.  They should make the cheese an option.  Got a salad as a wrap.  It is ok, but the raw carrots in it add hard cruncy bits you hae to deal with.  Finally, the Guiness tasted strange.

bHJXSVOmTal_zr9oNQPMHg.text: typical bar food,  not fantastic but edible.  probably frozen then cooked at order.  great patio overlooking green belt.  Ashley and I stopped there on bike ride to lake by ASU.  Played frisbee  in green belt below patio after brunch.  cool place to stop. lots of televisions inside but did not go inside.

mS5j2YpWGjuLsd3VujAQYA.text: I love this place. I don't even think I can say a bad word about this place. Their food is pretty cheap and it's always been awesome. Their pitchers are cheap they're less than $7 and  the service is awesome. They've got 3 patios, 2 of which are smoking. They don't mind if you make a ruckus and they've got free pool which is great. Their drunk driving thing is great too if you live within 6 miles and it's free.

V_bvPkUiPM9kX8GB8q2Eww.text: i love salad wensday it is the best day of the week for me because dukes has some of the greatest salads! they have all kinds of tvs and tons of room to play darts, pool and ext. this is forshur a great place to come have a drink and have alot of fun!

pfBbgbnW41cZBsrtC8S6yw.text: Well Condor and The Duke go way back, but Sunday was the first time I went for "Brunch".  After vigorously exercising along the Scottsdale greenbelt with Scraps, the Wonder Dog ("SWD"), for over 10 minutes, we ascended to the patio at Dukes. While I recovered from the workout, Angie, the pet friendly waitress, attended to SWD with ice cold agua fria. The Breakfast Burrito with chorizo was the next undertaking and it was muy bueno. Although no sports were on that early (well the Indy 500 was on, but that is just driving and I can do that locally), the Patio at Dukes was the perfect place for an early morning for a Man and his  Dog.

C9Oqpu4AxBN1B5vzagpCwQ.text: I am not usually the "sports bar" type, so the first time I went to Duke's, it was because of a friend's recommendation for the food.  The daily specials are quite a steal and since we went on a Saturday, getting a decent ribeye for less than $9.00 seemed like the way to go.  We enjoyed the meal, had the patio to ourselves and it was a lovely day.  When we cashed out, the server gave us a birthday postcard to fill out, so we did.  Last week, my fiance received his, so we decided on going Saturday so he could have the ribeye.  This time, we sat inside because it was a bit cool outside.  A bit loud and way too much basketball, but hey it's a sports bar, right?  Again, the food was good, especially considering their really low prices.  My guys vodka tonic wasn't up to par, but all in all, we enjoyed the experience and will go again next month for my free birthday meal.

O9YEh6pUVh57leBnzeJ9ng.text: We go here after softball games on Thursday night. The drinks are cheap, the food is great, and the service is outstanding. The biggest draw to this place is the bar itself. It has lots of pool tables and dart boards, two huge patios that overlook the green belt and lots of TVs. My only complaint is the Karaoke they do on Thursday. It is horrible and ruins the whole vibe there. Oh, and they have the no DUI car that will drive you home for free...but don't forget to tip.

eNmLkPQGBKBKUkykGN2Rwg.text: Duke's doesn't have the best food or beer in town, but the patio is dog friendly which is neat!  I have brought my Boston Terrier - BUDDY here a few times and we both like it!  The clientelle at this bar is very "old school" and mostly "older".  The nachos are really good and the CHILI CHEESE FRIES are quite good also.  They have kilt lifter on tap and a pretty good selection of other beers.   It's fun to look out onto Vista Del Camino Park at the passers by as you nibble on your food and sip your ice cold beer!!  Everytime I see Duke's I think of Fraiser's Dad from that TV show and he the name of HIS bar was also "Duke's"

9Te4k233QnLyFMAVOIOCZw.text: I'm not a fan. Other than one cocktail waitress the service has been RIDICULOUS.  Most of the food I have had is pretty gross, wings were ok. The only reason this place gets 2 stars is because they have free pool nights.

kuU1evcaBX1-oTLc9ftwgg.text: Such high hopes I had for Dukes.  Opening night of the NFL...exitement is high, the place is packed.  We're eating, drinking, watching the game, the crowd is into it, when mid way thru the 3rd quarter, a microphone comes on interferring with the NFL broadcast, announcing its time for TRIVIA!!!!   WTF!!!!  Its opening night of the NFL and you're holding a trivia night!!!!!  Unf***king believable!!  This is a "SPORTS BAR"?????  I mean...what can I say!!!  I'm so tired of "sports bars" playing karaoke, holding trivia night or playing music while the SPORTS are on.  We immediately closed our tab and left.  The most pathetic part was that the waitress advised if we moved to the back where the pool tables were, we would not be able to hear the trivia!  How 'bout you move the trivia back there and let the NFL fans watch the damn game!!!  Very, very sad.  Sports bar??? HA!!  What a joke!  BTW, my wife ordered the "full" order of ribs, expecting a full rack, but recieved what would be considered a "half rack" anywhere else.  On top of that, she said they were the worst ribs she ever had.  Just sayin'.

BDE_PZthW2gHYcardX4g_w.text: Today was my first visit to Dukes.  The location isn't idle, kind of off the beaten path, but upside... easy parking.  The atmosphere is great... exactly what you want out of a sports bar.  Lots of seating, lots of tv's, lots of pool tables... easy to get a beer.  I would recommend it for anyone looking to watch a game or have a beer at a chill spot.

DPYmP3qcobT_ZOJJq18XNw.text: Dukes has got to have the worst wait staff I've seen these days. I used to live down the street and probably would've considered it to be my favorite dive bar in the area for a while. I've recently returned and have to say it had to be the absolute worst crap bar dining experience ever. Hopefully they still have good football Sundays. Otherwise I'd venture to say with the speed the place has gone downhill they should not be around too much longer unless the owner(very rude, drunk?, old man) has deep pockets. Unfortunately south Scottsdale does not have many good choices for sports bars. Good thing I don't live up that way anymore.

mav00fnULDIxcUKleSDsDQ.text: This is my spot.  Great food, I can watch my game with no problem.  I have to have sound.  They really treat you right.  Oh, and did I mention the awesome food.  Plus, they'll get you home safe with a free ride.  If anyone else asks you, tell them that Sunday football there sucks.  Only because we don't want it to get any more crowded.  We don't like waiting for our beers.

ya5oK1lQVBsFsdMj3lU90g.text: When the bartender says it sucks, then the place must really suck.  A group of us went here on a Wednesday night and we were told that this place was really bumping before.  Two churches close by complained and the original owners picked up a left for a new location.  So whatever you heard in the past probably don't hold up to what it is now.  My co-worker that saw this place in the hey-day was really disappointed.

fhEdbW_HVX92vgISqHAPkw.text: this place pretty much fits the bill for what you expect.  beers.  lots of pitchers.  they even have some device that i haven't seen before to actually keep your pitcher cool while you're drinking away.  club sandwiches, burgers, fries and lots of televisions with just about every possible sporting event showing within your view.  i wouldn't say it's incredibly impressive or the clientele is going to make your jaw drop so you don't necessarily need to drive all over town to get here. but if you're in the neighborhood and need to quench your thirst with a basic selection of beers and kill that pang of hunger with serviceable food while watching the game on solid, average-sized screens then this place will suffice.  this place values consistency over being stellar and i guess there's nothing wrong with that.

_BWxonAhThtWHb9Ri-gxug.text: Duke's is a great place to grab a beer and watch a game. Weekday lunch is busy at Duke's but the salads are great and cheap. Check out the crispy buffalo chicken salad...
